An uber-chic hotel this ain't, but there's a great party atmosphere and pool is lovely with lots of sun loungers. Good value and great fun. Loosen up - it's Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Msim56003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have booked this trip to Vegas and ended up with the Hooters Casino through Hotwire. The service was friendly and parking is free. Location is right next to MGM, so perfect and safe. A great place for people who are in Vegas to party and not spend any time in their room. Everything is very old and the smell of cigarettes went up to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Free Slot Play is not worth the journey.”
Reviews.Author: bitesizecards
Reviews.Content: The Hooters Hotel and Casino is located off the strip, and although we didn't stay there during our visit, we were tempted to go in for the $200 Free Play promotion. The free play was limited to only a sectioned off area of 10 machines with a $5 play/game. The payouts for the machines were for chicken wings at Hooters, and other non-monetary prizes, with the exception of the top prize which was $1000. From what we witnessed during our play during the free slot play, no one won. ($200 only lasted about 7 minutes!)

Reviews.Title: “GOOD EYE CANDY AVERAGE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: RaiderRobert
Reviews.Content: pretty average place, no refridgerators in the rooms just an ice bucket which is a pain if you are staying more than one night. I stayed a couple so had to bring a cooler from my truck. The food was ok, drinks fairly cheap, I did get propositioned by a hooker in the sports bar area, so that wasn't too impressive. The girls overall look cute but tired, the pool area was nice overall it's ok if you want a cheap Vegas hotel for a couple of nights, but there is a "resort fee" to pay on top of your room price.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hoot”
Reviews.Author: mackozie
Reviews.Content: Great palce to stay considering the low cost. A huge Steak and two beers $12.38. And great steak too.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine stay”
Reviews.Author: whereisdave
Reviews.Content: Everything will depend on your expectations. I have been to Vegas several times, including staying at the Venetian the week before this, and this time was in town for about 15hrs for a concert at the MGM. If that is what you are doing the location could not be any better other than staying at the MGM itself or maybe the Tropicana. Room was spacious, casino was fairly non-smokey and small by Vegas standards so very quick to walk through- some hotels will take you over 15min just to get out the front door. 24hr pool, one of the two hot tubs was roped off as others have stated. Got a coupon for 10 free wings which I enjoyed, and after midnight they are 10 for $2.50. Also got a free American breakfast which was nice. Cons- Yes elevator is worn. Carpet in room could use replacing, bathroom was out of a lower middle class home built in the 70s. AC was an old school wall unit. There is a charge for internet. I paid around $120 for a weekend night, which was good vs what else I found on-line (not sure what other people do to get super cheap weekend rates...?). So again I had a fine stay. If this is your one time dream vacation to Vegas spend appropriately and stay at one of the fancier hotels.

Reviews.Title: “always wanted too”
Reviews.Author: jamo89
Reviews.Content: been to vegas a few times but usually stay with friends but checked in for a few nights i think for the price you pay its across the street from the mgm and the strip i dont think you will get anything else that close that cheap and plus you can get wings delivered to your room

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sharif_M
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this: This hotel is just fine. I've seen many bad reviews, and have this to say: you can't pay for sirloin and be disappointed when you don't get filet. For starters the location is great. You are caddy-corner to MGM and the 2nd hotel off the strip. Being close to Excalibur gets you free train access down to Mandalay Bay as well. As for the rooms, our room was clean and smelled fine. Everything worked. It was definitely a 3 star hotel that could use a renovation at some point, but I paid $60 per night including the weekend (would have been $50, but I wanted the refundable rate just in case). The hall smelled odd every now and then, but never inside the room. I had to try several floors before finding a soda machine that took bills, but a minor inconvenience at worst. The pool area was small but peaceful. It had 2 hot tubs, but one was roped off. This is not a typical vegas hotel pool...think the size/atmosphere of a days inn or la quinta. But it was relaxing to sit out there. The bud light drafts were always $1.50, which was a great deal while sitting at the pool waiting for my wife to get her makeup on. We even tried the mad onion restaurant the last night for quick eats...the food was surprisingly good, and was cheap. Much better than an actual hooters restaurant. The casino was small and not as smoky as some of the others. The service and staff were all acceptable...I didn't need them much, and had no problems. Our bags were stored for free, and we had an early check-in at no charge. In summary, if you're looking for Vegas on a budget, this is a great place to stay for the price. I will probably go a little higher end next time I travel, but if I don't I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gross room, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jaimee B
Reviews.Content: We got a deal through Travelocity so we didn't know where we were staying until AFTER we booked, we were not able to cancel. I called the day before we were to arrive to see if they had a crib available and the man told me they did and it was free. We left the playpen at home and when we got to our room, we called Guest Services to have a crib sent up. They called our room about 15 minutes later to make sure we were aware of the $25 charge. I told her we were told it was free and she said 'nothing is free'. We decided to get it anyways because our baby will only sleep by herself, it took 2 calls to Guest Services and over an hour to get the crib!! Terrible, terrible service. The room was disgusting, there was pee in the corner of the closet, the carpet was filthy, the tile in the bathroom had never been scrubbed, one of the beds was broken, I could go on and on and on. This hotel is disgusting and we will never stay there again. I wish I could give it 0 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place.”
Reviews.Author: EricMaypother
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hooter Casino Hotel from October 3rd-13th, 2011. I was very pleased and will definitely be back again. The rooms were clean and roomy, the pool was nice and heated. When you check in you get free food coupons, I ate at Hooters every day I was there and the Mad Onion inside Hooters a few times. Once you get through the weekend the weekday rates are pretty cheap so I stayed a week and a half. Most of the dealers wore Hooters girls outfits, I don't play slots but they had a good amount of them, I play Blackjack which they had I think 4 tables including a $3 table 24/7. If you want to play games they don't have it's a short walk to other Casinos without having to pay their high room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine...”
Reviews.Author: miltonwar
Reviews.Content: This Hotel needs a restoration....we booked here because an expedia offer, so we didn't had a choice. Pros A walk distance from the Hotel to the strip. (5 minutes) near Mgm. Has a parking lot without any fee Has a Valet parking service Has a hooters restaurant Cons Rooms needs restoration Tv service has only 20 channels Doesn't have wifi This was not the Hotel I was looking for a stay in Vegas. You get what you pay. Cheap Hotel, Cheap everything.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - tetanus shot required”
Reviews.Author: amrm6224
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely filthy. Elevators beat up. Reminded me of some of the 50 year old hotels at the party beach. The doors were beat up by the carts going in and out the doors. Elevators were down. If you try to take stairs, you end up outside on the second floor. Can't get to the parking lot outside from the stairs. Elevators had graffiti in them. If you want to sleep - you can't. Air conditioning unit didn't buzz - it ROARED. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for money. Stay here with confidence.”
Reviews.Author: beachbuddy10
Reviews.Content: 21 hours travelling didn't stop our aging legs going out on the town. A little slow to check us in, the staff more than made up by the time we checked out. No fewer than three ladies asked if we needed help finding our room (we did). We had coffee and pastries by the pool in the morning and the security guy chatted with us about life in Vegas. The place was clean, the room exceeded our expectations and the proximity to the Strip only added to our enjoyment. Even the taxi driver gave me half his tip back! Not that I was taking notes, but the legendary Hooters girls were stunning. For the record no happily married couple should ever have any worries that this hotel is in any way "unsuitable". It was all good clean fun!

Reviews.Title: “More than what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Djkylethom
Reviews.Content: After reading plenty of recent dodgy reviews of the hotel and it's whereabouts I was pleasantly surprised to find my stay there fantastic. For the price we paid its unbelievable value. The hotel is across the road from the main casinos MGM and new York new York and only a short walk from the rest of the action. The rooms are standard and nothing more than you need in Vegas unless your holiday consists of spending it all in there! The pool is clean and well kept aswell as the bars that are the cheapest in Vegas by far, bud for 1.50!! 7+ dollars anywhere else. The onion restaurant is unbelievable value for money and as good as the main restaurants in vegas. Beware of the hooters restaurant though, disgusting food and even worse service.... The girls are good to look at but they're slow and nobody seems to have a clue how to seat people. We saw 5 tables empty yet still had to wait 20 minutes for one?? Stay clear and go to the onion at the front of the hotel. I'll definately book again for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Vegas! From bad to worse!”
Reviews.Author: Kim C
Reviews.Content: We understood that check in time was 4pm but decided to see if we could get the Whirlpool suite that we book earlier. We wanted time to relax and rest up for the evening to come. So they told us the room was not ready yet and they would put a rush on it to keep checking back with them. We did, still wasn't ready. Then they gave us a room number to check back on. Well come to find out that room number was not suppose to be rented out due to renovations. But they would give us someone elses room that has not checked in yet. I didn't think that was right either. When we got to the room, the counters were dusty and the whirlpool was dirty, so my husband tried to clean it out. Then the water would not drain. The button to turn on the whirlpool was grimmie and the whirlpool didn't work. So we called mangement and Said they would try to find us another room of the same type that had a whirlpool that worked. They rushed to get ready the room that was not available due to renovations. They had one hour to find us something and it took them two hours. The front desk was rude to us but the manger was really nice. The casino was clean and the dealers were nice. We ended up booking the same type of room at another hotel on the strip for alot less then we where gonna pay at Hooters. We had one bad exsperience after another.

Reviews.Title: “For the price....you cant beat this place! Great location and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ceckitti
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about staying at the "Hooters" hotel, but that all went away once we saw our room. For 40.00 a night...you couldnt beat it! The staff was all more then friendly, the casino and hotel were clean and fun. 80s music pumped in the casino all day. The pool was open 24 hours but we didnt get to enjoy it due to the cold weather that week (55s and rain). I noticed that some people complained about the elevators.....REALLY? Get over it. Its a parking garage elevator!! LOL The only problem we really had was that our room (strip view) was facing some VERY bright lights that they used to light up the side of the hotel. Well...they also light up the inside of the room as well. And they are VERY VERY bright! Was hard to get the room completely dark, even with all the curtains drawn. We would have NO problem staying at the Hooters on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: shayleentaya
Reviews.Content: The room service was great. Cheap and delicious. The hotel/casino offers $1.50 Bud Light 24/7 which is the best price around. Its not a far walk to the strip, so the location isn't bad either. The bed was extremely comforable. I would definitely stay there again, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: go4ittttt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hooters because it is relatively inexpensive. Drinks are expensive. You cannot win at the slots and they have some cockamamy skeem for getting you to join their rewards club where you get $500 in free slot play that is a total scam. That been said, the rooms were 2 1/2 star with a bamboo vacation theme. Waterfall at pool was turned off and the pool is not open from Labor Day to Memorial Day. They make you pay an extra fee whether you use the pool or not. They take your deposit and don't give it back for three days thus using the money for the corporation for three days. Do NOT touch the girls!!!! I'm not gay but that is a huge rule and they will kick you out if you do. Just things to watch out for. Typical Vegas and this from a local. Also, not little fridge or coffeemaker so you have to go downstairs for any little amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice clean place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jayball102
Reviews.Content: What most people need to remember is that this is not a mega hotel that has been built in the past 2 decades. This hotel is older and you need to keep that in mind when your staying here. This is my second time staying at this Hotel/Casino. In the past I stayed in a suite but this time a regular tower room. The room was clean, but dated. The maid staff was good every day of this 5 night stay. The gambling is friendly as a younger crowd is present. The pool is very nice for a smaller hotel adn is open 24 hours. This was nice to grab a beer and hit the hot tub at 3 in the morning. The only negative was the "Dirty Joke Show". I would NEVER go back even if the tickets were free. Luckily they were this time.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected. Poorly managed.”
Reviews.Author: azroyalsfan
Reviews.Content: Knowing it was the former San Remo, I anticipated spartan accomodations that would be made up for with friendly service and Vegas caliber Hooters girls. I was pleasantly surprised with my room and the overall physical aspects of the Property. However, the entire operation is understaffed. If your expecting to be surrounded by gorgeous and friendly Hooters girls, you will be dissappointed. It's bascially a hotel that has a hooters in the back. They don't even have Hooters girls working in all of the Bar locations. There was no bell service. They had 1 front desk clerk. I had an issue with my internet and the hotel operator said"they are busy checking in guests, how late will you be up? Try again later tonight". Mad onion had 2 hostesses but only 1 server at breakfast. One night at the bar in the actual Hooters, every stool was full but only 1 bartender. I had to have the Valet paged to get my car(he was in the casino?). At this price point, I prefer the dives down on Freemont street, more activity down there. Otherwise, book one of the budget options on the strip, or stay at a non casino airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The room was OK, the Resort Fees, no so much”
Reviews.Author: TedRecupero
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in one of the cheapest rooms. The room was nice, the people were nice. The pool being open 24 hours a day was very nice. Didn't gamble, but did order and try to eat a meal at the The Seven Onion. They call this fine dining. I left most of it. It was borderline inedible and the service was poor. Never did get my Diet Coke. If you can't make an edible Patty Melt..... The nachos were made with canned cheese sauce. They call this fine dining? I can't imagine what the food at the "Hooters" was like. I would stay there again, but I will probably stay at a Harrahs property to avoid the "Resort Fee" scam.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Caity G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was seedy and unclean. It was in a poor location- all the way at the end of the strip. It was a decent walk to any respectable casino.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok.”
Reviews.Author: shasha0777
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was close to the strip and the cheapest. The room was ok. It was clean. The bathroom seemed a little run down. The bathroom has soap and shampoo. However, the shampoo bottle I got was half empty. I was only there for one night and alone so I didn't need more than what was left for me. The TV was older. The TV remote didn't work. The air conditioner is loud. I ended up turning it off so that I could sleep. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were very clean and seemed new.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average...”
Reviews.Author: StuartPowell
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay at Hooters Casino Hotel. The location was good, literally a 5 minute stroll from the south of strip (New York, New York and MGM etc) Check in was a little slow, but not a huge issue. We booked the cheapest room available, and it was very clean, very comfortable and had a decent view of the pool. I believe this was in the "Ocean View" section. The hotel itself is very small in consideration to the others on the strip, but this wasnt a problem. The pool area was great. A good selcetion of music, and very clean with beds always available. The waterfall pool was freezing cold though. The sun does set behind the hotel fairly early in the afternoon. The staff at the hotel were ok. Didnt really have much interaction with them. The Hooters restaurant itself was very poor overall, but the Mad Onion was much better. Overall, I was pleased with the hotel. If you go there expecting the Mirage, you're going to be disappointed, but it is not a bad place to stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “worth your money”
Reviews.Author: liu Z
Reviews.Content: well, I used 19dollars to have a night in Hooters and Hoooters gave very considerate services. I am very satisfied of living here. Besides, it is very near to strip. So the location is very good compared to the cute price.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: Janet W
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the 1940's looking hotel just fine, the problem started at the elevator... old smell all torn up doors, tile busted, and the railing was just barely hanging on. Once we got to our floor we walked off the elevator to the 95 degree hallway smelling of mildew and looking like an old prison. We got to our room to find hair in our beds and yellow pillows, mildew in the shower, and black stained up bathroom floors. I didnt even want to walk around in that room. We called the front desk and no problem, they switched us to another room! Well after walking all our luggage back down again we were given a "better" room. (the pictures are of the BEST room we got) This one was exactly the same but with more disgusting beds and an ac that was either hot or cold. SO WE CALLED AGAIN.... Now we get a "pool view" room. (thats was ours was to begin with) but another upgrade. We were so tired and furious by this point of walking back down AGAIN that this next room better be clean.... well the only difference is, we didnt have hair in this bed. But to top off the nasty hotel, the pool was only half open each day and we were there a week, two things were stolen while the room was cleaned and service desk didnt care,you pay 9.00 per day for ammenities, which doesnt include wifi because they dont have it, but it pays for your miniture water bottle and pool time?! I recommend NOBODY ever stay at this NASTY no service hotel..... Never did we get to talk to a manager.... I will not stay here again, especially when I can stay somewhere with good service ON the strip

Reviews.Title: “Garbage!”
Reviews.Author: ibeshane
Reviews.Content: An absolute disappointment! The managers, staff, and security were incompetent! Took 24 hours to get an ironing board and it took 2 hours for room service. We had a broken toilet, mold, leaking bathtub, clogged drains, and smells that would gag a maggot! The pool area smelled like sewage too. Also, their Mad Onion restaurant had horrible service. Bottom-line.....this place was a dump! I am thankful my wife and I decided to leave our children with family. Do yourself a favor and spend a little bit more money and stay at a place where you are not at risk for disease...

Reviews.Title: “Worst service - even the manager was rude!”
Reviews.Author: R T
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, spent 4 days in Vegas. The trip was great, outside the hotel. We originally booked the hotel through Hotwire.com over 2 months before the trip, so didn't know which hotel we were committing to, but it showed as 3 star hotel, on the strip, with 3.5 stars on TripAdvisor, so we booked it. Was going on a golf trip with 2 other guys, so Hooters was fine when we found out. Problem started at checkin. They didn't have our reservation, and said Hotwire didn't fax it. The girl at the front desk said, nothing they could do, "next time book directly through us". Seriously? I ask if they can call Hotwire for me - 'can't do that'. I was surprised at the attitude and inhospitality. I asked to speak with the manager - she wasn't available to talk to us. I ask if they can at least get us in a room, I'll give them my credit card number - I have confirmation number, reservation number, everything Hotwire sent me to confirm I went through and paid for this room already. While at the desk, I called Hotwire, where I was on hold for over 20 minutes. When someone finally came on, they transferred me and refaxed (they said their records showed originally faxed in June). They couldn't stay on the line with me, so waited (all the while, I'm waiting at the registration desk). I waited for another 10 minutes, it never came through, so had to call Hotwire again (again Hooters tells me, nothing they can do, I need to call them, and ask them to fax it again). They said they didn't even have Hotwire's phone number. While on hold, ask to speak to the manager again, this time she was available, this is where things started to really fall apart. She essentially said "that's what I get for booking through a 3rd party", I didn't even know how to respond to that. She said nothing they could do. When I finally got Hotwire on again, they again refaxed (I can't believe they're doing all this via fax). This time the Hotwire person stays on the line with me. Another 10 minutes later, Hooters finally gets it. Just to upset us more (it seemed), the counter person checks in the next group in line instead of us. All in all, I get into the hotel room over 2 hours after we got to the Hooters. No apologies, just a bad attitude. I would have been fine if they were polite about the whole matter, I understand things go wrong with technology. But to blame me for making reservations not directly through them, to be rude (not just from staff, but from the manager), unbelievable. BTW, hotel is in terribly old, run down condition (this is in the old San Remo), the dealers were rude, and the elevators smelled.

Reviews.Title: “What a dive!”
Reviews.Author: kencon70
Reviews.Content: The hallway to the room had a disgusting smell, a cross between cat urine and mildew. The carpet in the room was worn out and dirty. Tile in the bathroom had seen better days. Not enough clean towels for 2 people left daily, and no shampoo...just a random bottle of hair conditioner left on occasion. A/C very loud, and freezing cold or none at all; no in-between choices. Casino was old, a few newer machines, good service though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melita06
Reviews.Content: Love my room, it was really clean and the beds are so comfortable. I had a view of the pool. The only issue with the bathroom was tha the water in the tub took forever to go, but it didnt bother me. LOOOOOOOVE the vanity mirror. The pool was great and the guy from the pool was reaaly helpfull. Love my 2 free frozen drinks. The casino es small but i like small casinos. it will be great if they had at least 2 blackjack tables of 3dlls. We sign up for the owl rewards card and play the 200dlls promotional play, we did not win but it was fun playing on a 4dlls machine. I got a summer special so i got a 2x1 dinner at mad onion, it was sooo yumy, the corn that came with the steak was the best i ever had. I also had 2 free breakfest and they were really good. Another thing i got for free was 2 order of wings at the hooters restaurant. They where ok, i also bougth an apettizer and 2 drinks and just spend like 8dlls. The only night i got a seat at the 3dlls blackjack table i had a lot of fun with 12dlls i play hours and got a lot of free cocktails. The slots did not pay me. I will stay again at hooters again, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “They say you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: coastalsoundz
Reviews.Content: In terms of value, people are quick to point out that although Hooters is a block off of the strip (10 minute walk to Las Vegas Blvd) that it is a tremendous value for the location. I disagree. the savvy traveler can easily find comparable prices at much more luxurious hotels all over the strip. Travelocity, Kayak, even Hotels.com regularly feature deals that are comparable, or a touch pricier than the packages offered at Hooters. But, in deference to savings I gave it a whirl this time. I will never do it again. The casino was decent enough. A bit condensed, less floor space than you're used to so the smoke is a bit thicker than usual. Nothing about this hotel was clean. From cigarette butts on the floor of the restaurant to mold on the shower curtain, this place was doomed to get a negative review from the outset. Check in was easy and friendly, and the pool was a relaxing and convenient way to...recover from the previous night's festivities. Apart from that, there were no redeeming qualities. Do yourself a favor, shop around, or if necessary, spent the extra $40-50 bucks and save yourself the inevitable tetanus shot after you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great time as always”
Reviews.Author: risingsunhrs
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at Hooters for the past 5 years on my vacations to Vegas and not once have I had any complaints or problems, the service and staff are tops in my books. It puzzles me from time to time when I check this site and read bad reviews about Hooters. For the rates they charge their service is the best and the hotel is clean. if you want better go and pay 300-600 or more per night and get it but stop complaining, like i say Hooters is Tops for what they charge, even the resort fee is low compaired to other resorts, the food is good at both Hooters and Mad Onion ( loved the steak promotion this year very tasty ). Hooters will continue to be my choice when in Vegas, I found them by accident and happy I did. Keep up the GREAT work.

Reviews.Title: “Best secret in town”
Reviews.Author: bajangold
Reviews.Content: Stayed here so many times and never fails to give the great experience. Great value for money, friendly staff, Bud at US$1.50 fantastic ....... cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “more then adequate”
Reviews.Author: denmarkv
Reviews.Content: Hooters Casino Hotel is a good choice. However, if you are expecting luxurious accommodations you will be disappointed. Hooters is located just off the strip, a very quick walk to the strip. It has multiple pools, multiple restaurants, a bar and a casino. The rooms are large, clean and the water pressure is good. If you were to confine yourself simply to the hotel for the duration of the trip you could still have a pretty good time, definitely not the best time. After having said that, Las Vegas is designed for adult fun. Vegas can't be enjoyed from an hotel room, you have to walk the strip, eat, shop, gamble, drink, party,etc. All of these activities require one to leave their hotel room. Even if you're staying in the best penthouse suite, to enjoy Las Vegas you must leave the room. Therefore, if you are looking for a decent hotel to use as a place to sleep, shower and chill between activities then Hooters is the right choice for you. If luxury is what you desire, I say Hooters is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Party like It's 1999!!!”
Reviews.Author: Willchill72
Reviews.Content: Pre-wedding jitters made it hard to sleep but the loud music kept me awake all night long and I was on the 26th floor. They need to consider the noise level for the hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: SMO23
Reviews.Content: ...although it was not the best place I have stayed by any means. It is a classic "get what you pay for". For the location I could not find a better price. It is a quick walk to the strip and easy access to public transportation. The room I stayed in (201) was large but with not much of a view. I did not really mind that since I did not plan to spend much time at the hotel. But the next morning when I was trying to sleep I kept hearing the beeping of trucks backing up for deliveries, which was just outside my window. The room was decently clean, as was the casino area. The staff I spoke with were nice and tried to be helpful. I had wanted to check out the pool area, but there was a thunderstorm the night I stayed and they kept everyone out. While I was waiting for my airport shuttle I had a beer at the lobby bar...$1.50 Buds are not a bad deal. If I go back to Vegas and am not on a tight budget I will probably spring for another place, but if I had to I could stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff- Good food”
Reviews.Author: ofallongirl
Reviews.Content: I booked Hooters online for a one night stay as it was $65 for a Friday night. The hotel reception staff acted like they did not want to be bothered with waiting on guests. They all seemed to not look up from what they were doing to see guests are waiting. We had the same experience at Hooters restuarant. The hostess seated the people ahead of us and never came back. We waited several minutes and nobody seemed to see us standing there. We left and went to the Mad Onion. We were seated promptly. The food and the service were great not to mention the beer was $1.50 which made my husband happy. We ate both dinner and breakfast at the Mad Onion and had only good things to say about the experience. The room we stayed in was on the top floor (10th). It seemed warm but the air worked fine. THe bathroom looked very old and worn. There was mold around the edges of the tub. My husband saw a silverfish type of bug in the room. I was annoyed there was no tissue (Kleenex) in the room. Bottom line if you are looking for a cheap place to crash, Hooters will fit the bill nicely but don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised & will return!”
Reviews.Author: KSherman
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas only for 3 days to see Linkin Park, so we decided to stay at Hooters to cut costs. We saw a special on Expedia that offered FREE breakfast, FREE drinks, FREE wings, among other deals so we were sold! And all for only $20 per night! We booked our stay on the Hooters website just to be sure to get this amazing deal. Everything was true and better yet the food was great! We also signed up for the Owl program and received 2 FREE steak dinners, and $300 in slot play! The room we stayed in had a King bed, very comfortable, great pillows, clean room, big bathroom, even a view of the strip. I read a lot of reviews and say that this hotel is so far off the strip, but we arrived in the evening and walked easily to the Luxor for dinner and a show. I don't think the location is far at all. The pool is clean and the loungers are very comfortable. We also had no problem finding a sunny spot each day, maybe because we stayed during the week. The Budweiser special of $1.50 draft or bottle (including Bud lite lime, might I add) was a huge hit with my husband, especially because it was 45 degrees when we were there. The gym was nice and clean and although it is on the smaller side I think I only saw one person in there so you get the whole place to yourself. (please note you have to let the front desk know you want to use the gym so your key works) Unlike most casinos in Vegas Hooters was not smoking, and everyone was super friendly...service is great too! My husband was playing at a $3 table and even I had free drinks!! All in all if you are not expecting a 4 star this is a great getaway for the price. We only paid $20 per night and had FREE breakfast and steak dinner, where else can you get that!! Give Hooters a chance I was not disappointed and we are already talking about when we can go back!

Reviews.Title: “Free steak dinner”
Reviews.Author: rjortega51411
Reviews.Content: I did not have a chance to claim my steak dinner because the day I signed up for the owls reward card my wife and I had to catch our flight if we would have known how quick and easy it was to sign up I would have done it earlier. I will have to wait until next time to see if the steak is as good as the wings.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: angelsmag74
Reviews.Content: It's an old Hotel but very nice rooms for the price we paid. Bathrooms need a remodeling, but was ok. Hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The food was great and inexpensive. Beers were $1.50.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully Tacky, Yet Unrefined”
Reviews.Author: Sissy R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hooters because we found a great price online. It was true to it's slogan, "Delightfully tacky, yet unrefined". It was a nice, simple, clean place to land and the food at the Mad Onion was surprisingly good. We ate 5 low priced meals (it's only $9.95 prime rib and 10.95 New York Strip, $1.50 bottles of Bud) Only a half a block off the strip - we bought a three day monorail pass and travelled up and down the strip without complication. One of us did really well at the casino, too!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of likes with just a few of dislikes”
Reviews.Author: Big_Mel_N_LA
Reviews.Content: Likes: $1.50 beers all day and night in all bars and restaurants Hot Wings are $0.25 - $0.50 each at the Mad Onion Restaurant Pool and Hot Tub are open 24 hrs a day Close to the strip and across the street from the MGM Lots of low rates and specials Dislikes: It’s an older hotel with some renovations made but could use more up keep No late check-out available

Reviews.Title: “steak was burned! like charcoal”
Reviews.Author: cmbmba
Reviews.Content: i read that hooters was giving me a steak for free. well my email asked me to rate the steak that i already got for free at hooters. somehow i ended up here. as soon as i click on the email to rate the steak, it asks me to review the hotel stay at tropicana. i couldn't do what the email said. that is fake advertising. next they try to put popups to rent a room at tropicana. i see that there was a complaint with the rooms. i didn't stay in a room at tropicana or hooters. now the email says that i need to rate the stay at hooters casino hotel in las vegas. they know that i didn't rent a room. they want me to give a good rating and rent a room? i wouldn't recommend when a company is just full of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: cmjobson
Reviews.Content: We wanted a vacation that we could afford and the price was right at Hooters. Our room was nothing fancy but it was clean and our maid service was excellent. One thing I would suggest is that the carpets be replaced-they were looking worn-clean but worn. The beds and pillows were more than satisfactory and I am very fussy. Extra towels were provided when requested. The pools were very clean although the lounge chairs could have used some repair. The food in the restaurant and the Mad Onion was delicious. We were gifted a free steak dinner at the Mad Onion which was delicious. We were treated royally. The atmosphere was exactly what was advertised-rugged western theme. The Hooters girls were hard working daughters of ordinary people not sleazy street women. I have told friends and coworker who want to get away but have limited funds that Hooters is close to the strip and a great value-without sacrificing standards.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of fun!”
Reviews.Author: metaldan
Reviews.Content: The FREE steak dinner was awesome! My wife and I added 2 lbs. of crab at $7.95/lb to our dinner, and were pleasantly surprised when they brought out king crab! We stayed for 4 days and wound up getting free steak for 2 days, and had the prime rib for the other 2 (which was also very tasty!) A grand total of next to nothing for hearty eating! The dealers running the craps table (which is all we play) were hilarious and very helpful! They made the experience very enjoyable! We won good and got pretty tipsy in the process! Bud Light bottles for $1.50...need I say more?!?! That includes all bars within the casino. Tip-- if you like to people watch like we do, grab a stool at the bar by the front door and watch away! The pool stayed open 24 hours, which is about unheard of in Vegas. Whatta treat! The pools and hot tub were clean and inviting, and we met some really cool people there and partied the night away! Great way to relax and wind down on a hot August night!

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Witzbold26
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a whole week everyone I ran into said you get what you paid for, no one liked it there. They didn't vacum the floors there was stains everywhere on the carpet. We got in late and we didn't notice the mirror was cracked, we went swiming the next day and when we got back I was going to hang up our clothes so it wouldn't drip everywhere, well as I was grabbing a rack, I noticed the bottom of the mirror was cracked I called maintence they came up and fixed it, then sercuity came up to take pictures and the mirror was already replaced so they said we wouldn't get charged for it. So when it was time to check out they charged me $150.00 on top of the resort fee that is not cheap I believe one of the maids had broke it and they just wanted to blame a guest and not their workers. The hooter girls are pretty old and they never looked happy. The place looked like it was falling apart. By our room there was a giant hole in the wall. They never came and picked up people's room service until the next day. We will never stay there again!. There was a nasty smell through out the whole place. I asked for a extra blanket and they never brough it. The service and whole hotel was just not what I expected. So I hope this helps you to not go here, I'm not writing this because I had to pay for the mirror I'm writing to let everyone know, it's a crap hole and not worth the money to spend here. The casino is really small and I never seen anyone win anything.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Raewyn M
Reviews.Content: Once again, a great place to stay. Nice rooms, great facilities and close to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Just avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcamp001
Reviews.Content: I had to extend my stay at the Mirage due to a hurricane and needed one more night. Hooters was all that was available, so I booked the extra one night here. I paid 35% more for this one night then per night at the Mirage. Hotel looks like a badly renovated version of Motel 6. Rooms and hotel are aged badly, carpets were dirty, glass doors in room were dirty, you name it. Casino is small, not a lot of action going on. Staff was ok, no complaints, but there was only one Hooters girl, and she was the bartender. There is a Hooter restaurant on site of course, and there were a few more girls in there. Location is not great, being a long block off of the south end of the strip. The walk to the strip is long, and filled with trash and homeless people. I do not recommend walking through here at night. Better deals can be found at much better hotels on the strip, you just have to look. I do not recommend you stay here, I will not again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, small casino, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: janiceHoustonTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the last weekend in August for about 80 bucks a nite which included the resort fee they tacked on at check out... booked the rate online at Tripres.com and got some freebies with the booking which included two free breakfasts and was very good, everything was hot on our plates that should have been, massive quantity ( we could have shared 1 plate and been full ) and the breakfast potatoes were crisp and really good. The casino was small and I found the slots kind of tight but did hit a little jackpot so that was good thing and got lots of "free souvenieirs" from racking up some points on the player card. The room was okay. Had a tower room did not have much of a view, 9th floor, it was quiet, bed was comfortable, bathtub small and not real clean looking and the drains were slow... Liked the vanity mirror in the bathroom. The check in line was quick, the day shift people were nice, the night shift people ignored me, never got one free drink for 2 hours at video poker machine so when I hit a hand pay jackpot I only tipped the slot person since I never had one waitress ask me if I wanted a drink and I played for 2 hours before I hit. Overall I would give this place a 2star for a resort and would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the few Vegas values”
Reviews.Author: Zach W
Reviews.Content: I really like staying there. It's a cheap room, so that you can spend your money on other things. Probably the best part is the casino; you'll be hard pressed to find lower limit craps or blackjack near the Strip. Even better, you're a short walk from the MGM or the monorail to anywhere else you'd want to go. Hooters has a nice atmosphere, too. Just a bunch of people who want to have an unpretentious good time. If you go in with the right attitude, it's a cool place to have a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel, but great value.”
Reviews.Author: Randy G
Reviews.Content: Ok, this hotel is not posh at all. My room was old and my furniture was kind of crappy. But you know what? I paid about $40 for a room on a Friday night on a holiday weekend. That's awesome. And it's across the street from the MGM Grand where you can get your fancy-pants gambling on at a nice casino. So yeah, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Samurai eat Chicken too”
Reviews.Author: Ekim A
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and we were satisfied as usual. The price is good for what you get. We just needed beds to sleep in when we wandered back early in the morning. Plus it is located right near the strip. The front desk supervisor (a fuzzy haired kid) was not too friendly, but "Jenn" who helped us was charming and cordial, but gave no comps (haha). Enjoyed the gaming tables going in and going out. The Dirty Joke show was different and had it's funny moments. The Mad Onion had a good breakfast, but the staff do not seem happy. Last, but not least, the wings and other limbs were enjoyed at Hooters. I am sure we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A disgace”
Reviews.Author: ismaithliom
Reviews.Content: I have been to numerous Hooters in America but this Restaurant has to be the worst .I know that Hooters like to think themselves as "delightfully tacky yet unrefined" but this really takes it to the limit. I arrived on the 15th August at 9pm with two couples for a few chicken wings and a beer.I thought much to my innocence that this may be the best Hooters in America as it's Las Vegas and it maybe it's flagship business.Wrong on so many levels, it was dirty unkept and downright filthy.The waitress was good but overstretched. the food was very poor and greasy , never again.!!!!!. On this restaurant i will never set foot in a Hooters again , shame on you Hooters.

Reviews.Title: “Quality going down, prices going up?!?!”
Reviews.Author: JRod717
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here since they opened, several times a year since I live in So Cal. It uses to be cheap, like $100 for thur and fri nights. So I didn't complain too much about it not being very nice. But now they are charging upwards of $200 a night, and it's not worth it. There are always ants in the rooms. I've switched rooms for this reason only to find more ants :/ Their comforter is a duvet filled with stuffing so once you move around you have a big ball of stuffing in one corner and an empty duvet everywhere else! And there is no other blanket so you have no choice but to use it. The staff, in general is snobby, and unhelpful which really sucks because I'm there in a good mood, ready to have a great time and get stuck with killjoy employees!! If you can get a room here cheap, do it. But don't expect too much...

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is terrible”
Reviews.Author: Quigley M
Reviews.Content: I did not have a remote control in my room for my television and called house keeping. Two hours later, I still had not received the remote control. I finally went to get it myself. This place is a joke. Upon arrival I waited over thirty minutes with only two people in front if me. They only had 1 person behind the counter. If you're looking for a hotel with good customer service this is not the place. Get out of the hotel business Hooters! You're smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: BAB138
Reviews.Content: The front desk check-in process was extremely slow even though there were only a few of us in line. The rooms were not kept up very well - pretty outdated. Had to have the toilet, shower, and sinks unplugged daily. The overall service was poor, nobody every asked us how our stay was or etc. Just not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: sarahgravert
Reviews.Content: This hotel/casino definitely fulfilled our needs on our vacation. The rooms were nice and clean. Never had a problem with cleaning staff. The casino is nice and small. $2.50 minimum on the roulette table. We spent ALOT of time here. Only problem is this table seemed to always be full and they would not open the 2nd roulette table during the week. (We stayed Sunday-Thursday). One word of advice...they advertise $1.50 Bud and BL at all casino bars. This does NOT apply at Hooters Restaurant where they are $5.50 each! Pool was a little small compared to others on the strip, but the sun was usually so hot we didn't spend a lot of time there. Enjoy the pool in the morning, the sun falls behind one of the towers in the afternoon and the entire pool area is shaded. We ate at the Mad Onion twice. Once we had the .25 cent wings after midnight...very good, but the place was full. We had a short wait to be seated, and a longer wait to be served. The second time we ate breakfast. It was fabulous! Ordered way too much though. Share a meal or order Ala Carte Breakfast items.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: prideworks
Reviews.Content: The room at Hooters was large and clean with a comfortable bed. The maid left fresh towels when I asked for them. The slots were generally tight and the table games were hit and miss but had friendly, smart dealers. The resturants weren't too great, I'd look elsewhere for anything other than a hot dog or burger. I'd recommend Hooters for a budget friendly choice with close access to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and fun”
Reviews.Author: SallyJS
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about staying here with our 4 teenage daughters but all the staff were friendly and helpful. We had already read that the rooms were dated, which they were, but clean. The food in the 24hr restaurant was excellent for breakfast and dinner and good value - the waitresses were really helpful. We liked the pool and hot tub but be aware it is in the shade of the building after about 4pm. We thought it gave us a real Vegas experience with more character than the big hotels.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: lily s
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ok. There chicken wings are cooked in 80% of butter. Their in house steak house Mad Onions was horrible. It took them an hour and 15 mins to get our steaks to us. The steaks were so rare(we ordered well done and medium well) soon as you cut it open blood flowed all of the potatoes and vegs. Waitress was incompetent. The air-condition was broken on the second day of our stay. The water in the pool was so cold for the month of August and their jacuzzi was cold. Just a unpleasant stay. Wouldn't recommend it to anybody. Stay far away!

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: P J
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a dissappointment; granted I was there during the EDC, but there was somethings that had nothing to do with the EDC. 1. My door would not shut, had to call maintenance; they "fixed" and then it did the same thing the next day and throughout the rest of my stay....I had watched the repair man and just repeated his steps instead of waiting. 2. One of the two elevators was out of service for 75% of the time I was there; with no posted way out on the stairs. 3. Bathroom was clean, but very old looking.....caulking gooped, paint chipped, etc. 4. Just dissappointed from top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: FanofFlorida
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the H00ters Casino Hotel for three nights during a recent business trip. I found an amazing rate on Expedia and couldn't resist (all three nights less than $50 total). I had read mixed reviews so I had an open mind about the experience. I visit Las Vegas frequently but this was my first stay here. The check in was a little slow but there was a large group ahead of us in line. I wont gripe about the casino and hotel layout because I could criticize any hotel in Vegas for being difficult to navigate. Luckily this hotel is small. Also, this hotel is very close to the strip. It took us only 5 minutes to walk down and cross the street to MGM. The 2 queen room was large, offered lots of storage, a separate vanity and view of the pool. Housekeeping was fantastic. Although the room was slightly dated (by Vegas standards) I felt clean and comfortable. There was an additional charge for internet that we couldnt get to work anyway. The pool area was very pretty and OPEN 24 HOURS! The main pools were far too cold to use, but there was a lot of space in the hot tub. The staff we encountered here were friendly and helpful. For a great rate, I would stay here again. This is NOT a luxury resort. Go to another hotel if you are picky. If you are fine with clean and comfortable, this place will meet your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Just 10min from the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: Raendi
Reviews.Content: Through MGM or just straight via Tropicana Avenue you walk off the Strip to this good priced folksy hotel. Nice pool, good restaurants and familiar casino. Only negative was that "Dixie's Dam Bar" was closed, staff didn't know why and when it's open again...?

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for such a cheap price... I am sold.”
Reviews.Author: amber1027
Reviews.Content: Excellent deals on expedia sometimes for this hotel. Good location just off the strip behind MGM Grand but within a block or two of the strip. Pool was descent & open all hrs, but was out of towels when we went down. Dining at Hooters was great and the waitresses were fantatstic and the food simple but good. The room was very clean, ac and tv worked prefectly and beds were really comfortable. I think this will be the hotel I stay at from now on when I visit Las Vegas. Lobby/Casino is a bit more smokey that most on the strip, but that was the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Still Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: Diana7Michigan
Reviews.Content: Second stay at Hooters. I picked hooters again because of the location and quick access to strip and quick path threw casino to car. Rooms were clean, AC worked fine. The Hooter Salad was great so were wings. Casino waiteress were few and far between drinks. Slots rarely pay anything, so we played elsewhere. Great place to stay but not play. Only complaint is the bedspread slides onto to floor dureing sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap place in good location and beautiful swimming pool !”
Reviews.Author: Siestica
Reviews.Content: This place is good when you want to be close to the strip (5min walking distance from MGM, NY-NY and the rest) and don't spend to much money on hotel. It's a nice place, with a beautiful swimming pool, very clean rooms and friendly/cute staff (the waiteresses are all gorgeous and smiley, it's a pleasure!) They have the most amazing breakfast buffet I saw in LV, even when I changed hotel, I came there to eat my breakfast !! It's a really good place, and if you are lucky, your room can have a view on the strip, and I made posters from pictures I took there!!

Reviews.Title: “What A Garbage Pit”
Reviews.Author: cymanca
Reviews.Content: Friend(barely) booked the room. Arrived very late and got a 10th floor room. One of the two elevators was broken and the working elevator was 100 degrees, slow and smelled like beer, armpits and cat urine. Got to the floor and found the hallway dimly lit and 2 degrees cooler than the elevator. Room is also steaming hot and even though the air conditioner was set on high, it took 3 hours to drop the temperature. The room was old, the bedspread even older. I didn't even check the sheets because I slept on top of the bedspread fully clothed. The bathroom appeared clean but has fixtures that appeared to have been picked out when Bugsy Siegel first came to town. The casino is beyond well worn and if it weren't for the Hooter's waitresses looks and friendliness, this hotel would have gotten a zer0 on the rating system.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best of hotels”
Reviews.Author: debstar28
Reviews.Content: Not the best of hotels, although the cost is low, so I guess if you pay little - you get little. Front desk staff and in the Bait Shoppe need some serious injection of personality and pleasantness. Pool is OK as long as you like drunks around it especially at weekend where the game seems to be to get as drunk as you can as early as you can at the pool. Strange house rules as well - I wasn't allowed to video my family at the pool as it was a safety and security issue, yet the lager louts could be falling all over the place, have glass bottles and cans lying at the edge or in the pool and that seemed to be OK with security! Don't take that dangerous camera with you! Hotel in need of investment - ice and cold drinks machines never worked on amost half the floors daily, safe and toilet broke down during stay, had to chase a few rimes to get maintenance. On the positive side, it's only 2 mins from the strip and the $1.50 beers go down well. If you want a low cost, no frills, basic hotel and are Ok to put up with the weekend injection of drunks, then this place is for you. I'd rather spend a few extra bucks and get much better quality at the many other hotels available.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to crash”
Reviews.Author: larskappler
Reviews.Content: Don't go here expecting a super luxurious place. If this is your first trip to Vegas I would recommend staying at one of the mega resorts. However if you are looking for somewhere to crash cheaply, this is the place for you. Rooms are acceptable and had no issues with housekeeping. Pool is better then some of the strip resorts (Harrahs and Imperial Palace.) casino isn't the best but it has all of the basics. The location is pretty good, it's right across the street from the MGM Grand and behind the we didn't have wifi in our room, so if that is important, stay elsewhere. Room decor is what you would expect if you eat at Hooters restaurants. 50 cent wings after midnight makes for a good night cap after a long night if partying.

Reviews.Title: “great cheap hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: theellitts
Reviews.Content: cheap hotel room, great location,big room clean and tidy, cheap beer in all the bars, was the third time we have stopped there and will stop there again

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: krissie8808
Reviews.Content: the reason we picked HCH for our little week get a way was that my boyfriend wanted to go since he was there last and it wasn't open and it was very low rates. It's also right next to the MGM Grand so you're pretty close to wherever you would want to walk to. I LOVE this place! We got a rate of $16 per night on a weekday of course but still--- could not believe how nice it was for the price. We stayed in the bungalow and the tower and they were both great. The bungalows are smaller rooms but you are right next to the pool. Ours also had a balcony. Our tower room had no balcony but offered a nice view of Excalibur and MGM Grand and it was a much bigger room and bigger bathroom and also included a vanity, which is nice if you are a girl. their pool is GREAT. we went on what happened to be a windy day but it was still great...there is a beautiful waterfall and three pools, depending on what temp you like. the pool w/ the waterfall is the coldest, the middle pool is middle temp and the pool furthest from the waterfall is the warmest. nice jacuzzi too. also, the pool is open 24/7 - which is great. I know some hotels close their pools at 6 or 7pm...which I find crazy because this is Vegas! Hooters is open all the time. My boyfriend loves their $1.50 cup of beer and I have to say that their fries are amazing! you can eat by the pool too. they also have a gym which sadly, we did not have time to use. as a girl, I got a kick out of the decor which is very much for boys but that's ok because it's Hooters...what would you expect? the bedrooms are tastefully decorated, like a beach-y theme (see photos) the casino is one of the smaller ones but its nice and you actually know where you are going, not like the larger casinos where it can feel like a maze. the manager, Patrick was very nice and accomodating. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. We had a lovely trip! =^)

Reviews.Title: “All you need in a room!”
Reviews.Author: thedrew85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hooters Casino and Hotel for two nights. I had read reviews beforehand and thought I would take the risk. For two nights I payed $70 and had a room in the bungalow on the second floor. This included an $8.60 per night charge that I was informed about when I checked in. For this I got a room with a bed, TV, bathroom and some furnature. The room looked dated, but it was a place to get ready and sleep. There was a wait to check in, but I was checking in at 8pm when everyone else was! In order to get to the strip, there was about a 5 minute walk to the corner of the MGM Grand and New York New York. If all you need in Vegas is a bed to sleep in, a shower and a room to get ready, this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: TheErn
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at Hooters and there were no surprises. For the price you should not complain; good value for the money. If your not out to impress anybody and want to save some money you cannot go wrong at Hooters. If you’re into camping you will probably think this is 5* star accommodation. There is lots to do in Vegas and unless you intend to stay in your room during your vacation take the money you save on your hotel and go wild. This is Vegas! One of the few places on the strip where you can play 3 dollar blackjack! Enjoy your favourite beverage and have a Hooters girl deal blackjack. The blackjack dealer named “Sumi” was very cheerful; provided good natured assistance to the beginners at our table. Regarding the dreaded “Resort Fee” … they are NOT the only hotel that charges it and MOST hotels charge more. My only suggestion to Hooters would be to include the “Resort Fee” in the regular price. The exercise room was great for weights but think twice [three times] if you intend to go running outside. During the Vegas summer, the only time I would consider running outside would be early in the morning or in the evening. Being that I stay up late, I opted for the evening run and it was endurable. ***One running option I would like to try in Vegas would be to run the stairs of some of the hotels … I think it would be a challenge to run up the stairs of some of the big hotels. If anybody has any information regarding this option please post it.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: carpetking5432
Reviews.Content: Had a long weekend in Vegas to break up a week long trip to LA. Stayed at Hooters for a 2nd time and yet again had a fantastic stay as before the staff were friendly and the facilites were good Managed to get a walk in special and felt I was a winner straight away Best bargin in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jag16
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I am writing on tripadvisor. Having read the comments on this hotel before my stay I wasn't to sure what to expect, but this hotel exceeded all my expectations!! The rooms where clean and tidy. Not great looking but did the job, the aircon worked. The staff where really friendly and by the end of our stay we got to know some of the staff quite well, and had great banter with all of them. The good thing about this hotel is that the casino floor isn't huge which made finding my friends and family alot easier. Bottles of bud where $1.50 which was great and the location isnt that far from the strip!. If your going for a bachelor party/stag do this is a great place to stay. The pool area was nice and clean and the shade that some people have complained about was perfect as it was so hot!!! I would DEFINITLEY stay here again if I was going on a lads holiday

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great”
Reviews.Author: Sunsdude22
Reviews.Content: Overall I felt that this was a great place to stay for price and its location. It is situated right next to the Tropicana and the MGM is located just across the street which makes it remarkable for hoping right on the strip. I found it quite easy to just walk down the street and take the train to the luxor, or hop up the stairs and head to MGM. The hotel rooms are not bad, although I wish we would have had one that looked out over the pool area. Speaking of the pool area, it was pretty nice. We do not drink but it does have a pool bar. It also has two pools. One that is a normal temperature and one that is beyond freezing! This is the one with the waterfall. It also has a hot tub in between the two, with ample party music in the background. The casino was not too bad, and if you get a members reward card you can choose several perks but they have a designated area of slots that you can sit down and they give you $200 (can't cash out, have to play and win something) to mess around with which one might as well do because it is free. They have a decent amount of tables as well as two $3 minimum blackjack tables which always seemed to be full especially in the evening. There are two restaurants in the hotel. Hooters and The Onion. Hooters is, well, Hooters. They have ok food, but are best known for there wings. They do however seem to nickel and dime you for everything ( extra money to add celery to your wings order?) The Onion does boast a $9.95 prime rib dinner, but it reminded me of a cheap buffet. It is nice they are open 24/7 along with anytime breakfast but the price really is not worth it and the food is not great at all. The service is also very very horrible. Only good thing was it was convenient. As far as location, casino, and value I rank it among the best. Obviously it is not a superb luxurious hotel but for $22 a night (plus a dumb $8 a day tax which every hotel has) it was fantastic and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just the facts!”
Reviews.Author: davenarmy66
Reviews.Content: Came in at a busy time, only one person working the desk, 20 minute wait. Waited 15 minutes after porter said "I'll be right there" he never showed up. Waited 3 hours for internet to be fixed. Room service got my order wrong, total wait for correct order 1.5 hours. No free drinks anywhere in casino, not soda pop, not water. $3 for Pepsi. "promotional games" are just that, for promotion, NO ONE was winning anything, not a shirt, not a dinner, not a drink, nothing. Long line for promotions. Restaurant manager and chef were very nice and helpful as were the waitresses. Several staff member were short and callus when asked questions. I still love Hooters over all but they have a serious management problem here in Las Vegas. They have 12 hours to make things better but it does not look good.

Reviews.Title: “Went down for 30th Birthday & would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: mmaas81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went down for my 30th birthday July 7,2011. We had 9 people in our group and we all stayed at this hotel. It was our first time in Vegas and didn't want to spend alot on a hotel room. We weren't planning on staying at the hotel very long, because we wanted to see the other hotels and clubs. I was impressed with what you got for the price. The rooms were great for the price, the pool was fantastic, and they had prime rib for cheap. You are across from the MGM Grand and the Excalibur hotel and then kiddie corner is the New York New York hotel. You can take the Monorail to go to the other hotels like Caesars or Paris. I would say all in all we would highly recommend this place if you aren't looking to spend alot on the rooms. That way it leaves more money to spend on seeing shows or drinking alcohol! The only downside was that all of our rooms were on different floors, but you can take the stairs or the elevator. We were all within one floor of each other. No complaints would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “awesome time, low cost”
Reviews.Author: raineflash
Reviews.Content: We were reluctant to stay here becuase were planned a family trip our kids are ages 5-19, but the price was amazing so we booked. The hotel staff was so nice and helpful. we had no problems checking in a little early and checking out a little late. The pool is open 24 hours which the kids loved. 3 pools the kids could not get enough of. The rooms are clean and spacious. The location is not bad at all not to far from the strip. We had a blast here and I would definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it”
Reviews.Author: PanamanianSweety
Reviews.Content: As a Christmas present and Graduation gift, I brought my sister to Las Vegas. Now, I have stayed in different locations on and off the strip in my past stays in Vegas - and this was actually nice. Considering the price for the hotel and the location, we choose to stay at Hooters and are glad we did. They had a great winter promotion that was going on that gave us free wings, along with free play. We took on the wings as my intention was my kid sister having fun - not adult oriented events.. We ate breakfast at Mad Onion which was awesome! Country Fried steak was great!! Our room was clean and had everything we anticipated for a hotel room. Our view was the MGM and the top of the casino. Yes, there was trash and cigarettes on the top of the casino.. but then again who is walking on roofs to pick up litter daily from guests. Overall, I didn't have any complaints. For girls who were going out and shopping and hopping from place to place to place, I left a simple note for extra towels which was done, along with a personal note from the maid that if I needed anything to not hesitate to ask. Our beds were made daily, our items were left in exactly the same place we left them. Overall, we had a nice time at the hotel. Parking is made out to be completly terrible - but it was not an issue. Yes, the elevator was undergoing maintenence and the one corner of my bed was a little bumpy. I will say for the price that I paid for the rooms, I got more than expected. No one was rude, everyone was nice.. the location is great, the people were mostly families or young males/middle aged males. This place is laid back and I would for sure recommend this place if you are looking for a trip on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters Casino Great place for fun & Play at Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: Fromthepublisher
Reviews.Content: I was reviewing other hotels in Las Vegas, when I missed my flight and stumble on this great find of a hotel, which was contemporary, exciting, and had a great relax vibe that anyone would enjoy. What a value and what a surprise! I had the pleasure of meeting the front desk manager Patrick, who was friendly and very knowledgeable and was very helpful. Hooters Hotel & Casino, if not already is refining how the new young and hip are opting for hotels like this. It's a great place for fun & play at great rate. Any guest would feel very welcome but, most importantly guest will feel wonderful staying in there large spacious rooms that are clean and the casino is fun to play in and even give you a $200 Free play when you sigh up for the Owl Rewards Club. The restaurant serves a $9.99 prime rib served with mashed potatoes and corn on the cob that rival other Las Vegas’ upscale restaurant or hotels. The pool is remarkable, fun, and lively. Hooters Hotel & Casino despite being marketed to men it fulfills the formula of family and couples alike. It may not be glitzy, behemoth, Vegas casino-style hotel, but it sure manages to make guests feel that the hotel & casino is yet unique and intimate at the same time. The latter is due in part to the hotel’s verticality, which spreads the public areas over the first floor instead of several. Bars and gaming are concentrated on the ground floor; and rooms start at the second to the 10th floors, which make it quiet and family or business friendly. The Hotel is situated right in front of the MGM and to the right of the Strip. Which really make it easy to get to the Airport Freeway or back on to the Strip. I had a great fun time and stay at this wonderful gem of a hotel and the service was top notch. I am and I would highly recommend to my friends, family, and anyone coming to Las Vegas. You'll be pleasantly surprised!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: boardwlk
Reviews.Content: have stayed 4 times previously. rooms were clean and hotel provided everything needed. definately will stay again next time i come to vegas. staff was friendly, as well as everyone in the shops and restaurants. each time i have stayed in the ocean view or bay view rooms. definately the place to stay if you want to save and get a great room

Reviews.Title: “had a good time at hooters”
Reviews.Author: Sking222
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean the maid staff was friendly and helpful. It wasn't nothing fancy but it was nice and quiet and we slept good. The price we paind was very nice during the week. It was very nice for our getaway. The only knock was the dininh choices were few. But the girls were very cute and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Lisa-spec
Reviews.Content: My first time staying at this hotel (though I visit Vegas 1-4 times a year-my last hotel, the Sahara, closed its doors). It was a good price. It is an older hotel. There really is no view to speak of (but who really hangs out in their room in Vegas). The toilet liked to run. Faucets were a little outdated. The beds were pretty small (bigger than a twin/smaller than a double--really only room for one). With all that aside, service was always good and friendly. Checking in and out was easy and staff was friendly. Loved the 24 hour pool/sauna and shop (forgot the name). Loved the Wings and French Onion soup at the Mad Onion restaurant. It's a smaller hotel/casino, but quaint. Super friendly people. If you want a "fancy" hotel, this is not for you. If you are on a budget, and want friendly and quick service, this is the place to be. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Honestly nothing to worry about..We will return!”
Reviews.Author: lisarose912
Reviews.Content: I had read many of the reviews about Hooter's and was really intimidated about staying there but the price was just way too good to pass up. As soon as we arrived at check-in..my concerns completely disappeared! Check-in took all of 10 mins..on Father's day..rooms were clean..bed was perfect..service was great..staff was friendly and helpful. Food at Mad Onion & Hooters was yummy! If you like your coffee, we recommend buying the mug and getting your coffee free. We will recommend Hooter's and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and forgettable”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January for a friends birthday because they had a block of rooms here. We regretted staying here the second we walked through the doors. The casino is small and the rooms are awful. We walked in our room and the smell was overwhelming. There is no better way to put it, but the room smelled like semen. It was awful. To top it off the A/C wasn't working so the smell was "cooking" in the room. I figured we may have just gotten a bad room, but the other people with us had similar complaints (hot rooms, bad smells, beds that didn't sit flat). Needless to say it didn't take long for us to leave and stay at another hotel. Spend a few extra bucks and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quite complaining”
Reviews.Author: tarzan26
Reviews.Content: Everything was great from check-in to check-out. I read all the reviews and a lot of people like to complain but they probably complain about everything anyways. How anyone can complain for the price you pay should go to a 5 star, you probably would complain about that hotel as well. You have to understand that you get what you pay for. You certainly get your moneys worth plus more so instead of complaining just enjoy and spend the money you save on having fun. Bed was firm, room was clean, staff was courteous, beer was cheap and cold and the food at the restaurants was delicious. What else could you ask for. Did I forget to say that the Hooter girls were more than pleasing to the eye. Don

Reviews.Title: “We love it, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: KathyR_Upstate_NY
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hooter's. Our room was very neat and clean. The staff at Hooter's were very friendly and helpful. Check-in was very quick & easy. After our stay, they held our luggage for a couple hours before it was time to go the airport. Hooter's location is great, just off the strip and close to the airport. We hope to stay there again. Thank you Hooter for a wonderful time.....

Reviews.Title: “Great little find, just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: wordmongerer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 days and thought it was excellent. Unlike a lot of the other hotels there was no "theme" and as such we weren't paying for any gimmicks. The room we had was big, bright, tidy and comfortable. The only downside was no free wi-fi (no wi-fi at all) but the nearest McDonalds privided us with it instead. The hotel is next to the Tropicana and MGM though set back a bit. Anyone who says it is too far of the strip is obviously someone who finds a 5 minute walk exhausting! As a result of being set back it is quite quiet at night which is just what you need after a long day of hustle and bustle. We didn't come to gamble so cannot say too much about the facilities, but the casino was small (by Vegas standards) yet always seemed to be popular. The on site restaurants were handy and there is a resort fee of about $8 a day which covered the safe, use of the pool and car park. The resort fee was not optional, but good value if you did use the facilities. We were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel and would definitey stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Agian”
Reviews.Author: missdnell
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at hooters again. First of all check in is a joke I booked 2 rooms and when it was time to check in. They said they only had one room ready WTF? Ok so we get the one room and they say the other one will be ready in an hour. So we go up to the room and find out that the airconditioning did not work nor did the TV. So I go back downstairs wait in line another 30 minutes. The guy behind the counter say ok I can have someone come and fix it in a couple of hours or move rooms. Its F&%$in vegas the temp is 103 so we just moved rooms. The elevator was down several times during our 2 day stay the ice machine was broke and the ac stop working midway through the trip. I was truly disapointed with hooters and will not ever be staying there agian. However the food was pretty good and the price was great!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously fun, fabulous staff, clean, helpful, all about making our trip fun and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: ginapettijohn
Reviews.Content: This is the only place to stay! The casino staff is amazing, not stuck up AT ALL, so very willing to help, always went above and beyond to make things pleasant, hot food, cool rooms, great beds, so very clean and the price was amazing. I will go back time and time again!

Reviews.Title: “Scarey.... Very Scarey!!!”
Reviews.Author: LaurieAndersen
Reviews.Content: Our visit was one of the worse hotel stays ever! Mold, dirt, stains, cracks, running faucets, and that was just in our room. We even took pictures of it all. The employees hate their jobs - unfriendly, don't smile and just don't want to help you. The pool was freezing, pool furniture broken or weathered. Took pictures of that too. The only saving grace is the 2 restaurants have good food but poor, poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Mick3327
Reviews.Content: A very average hotel in a good location, only a block from the strip. Check in was a bit slow and friendliness depends on who is working. Some are, some aren't. My room was clean but showed signs of wear as did other parts of the hotel. Your hotel key which is supposed to work the back gate will not. This is an annoyance whenever you try to get to your car. I got a "we know but can't do anything about it" when I reported it. I stayed during the week when the rates are very reasonable. If i had to pay their weekend rate I would stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!! Do Not Book With Them!!”
Reviews.Author: Zudacris
Reviews.Content: Warning!!!! I highly recommend you not going to the Hooters Hotel and Casino! Horrible Customer Service!! Rude Rude Rude!!! Poor Maintenance of the hotel and very cheap!!! We had an Awful Experiance, feel free to email me with question [--]

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: cbo030
