Reviews.Content: just got back from staying here for 3 nights. i paid for the room in advance but when i got there i was told there were daily charges of $8 for things even if you didn't use them. so i had to pay another $24 on top of what i already paid. our safe didn't work, the toilet wouldn't flush, the balcony door wouldn't lock, and our room keys stopped working halfway through our stay. the casino is really small with minimal table games and most of them are closed throughout the day. the dealers weren't helpful but the waitresses were quick with drinks. the pool was okay and hooters food is always good. i just would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EVerything you want! Except style.”
Reviews.Author: bridgiebaby
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Bellagio, I was very hesitant to stay at Hooters, but if you go to Vegas on a whim, without much planning, you don't have a choice! And I was pleasantly surprised! Despite the lacklustre foyer and reception areas which are badly in need of renovation, the rooms were very nice. Granted, the decor is tropical-paradise-circa-1972 - complete with pine cupboards and fake palm tree (!) but our room was very clean and spacious, with wifi access, TV and playstation joystick. The mattress was one of the most comfortable I've had in a hotel in a while and the bathroom was spotless. I was also very impressed by the staff who were incredibly helpful. The security lady (Emanuela?) - even went to a store-room to get me a phone-charger as I'd left mine at home! They didn't charge for this, just asked that I returned it at check-out. Pool was clean and pool-bar service was friendly. Breakfast restaurant was good value for money as was their main restaurant. All in all, the princess in me coped very well!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: vickie0929
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip today staying at Hooters. I would say that this place is alot of fun. Had an amazing time at the pool and very cheap beers too. The pool staff was very friendly and always wanting to help. The rooms are outdated but clean and big. We asked for additional towels and they were up in our room in a few minutes. I would totally recommend staying here again. Especially if your in vegas to have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Smooth and Thrifty Experience”
Reviews.Author: kobe67
Reviews.Content: The Hooters Hotel and Casino is a very efficient place to stay when your in Vegas. The rooms are clean and reasonably priced. Location is great. The staff is friendly, especially a guy named Patrick. Patrick checked me in and was very helpful in answering all my questions. The only down side to the property is the Hooters Restaurant. The service at the bar was absolutely terrible. The waitresses are as slow as molasses. So other than the slow uninterested waitresses, everything else is a go.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Yellowknifer73
Reviews.Content: My friends and I took our first trip together in 20 years to Las Vegas. This was my first trip there, while my friends had been there before. On a whim we booked our stay at Hooters Casino Hotel, primarily because we got dirt cheap rates through lasvegasdirect.com. According to everything I had read it was supposed to be relatvely recently renovated place, clean, and close to the strip. Two out of three's not bad, I guess. It was clean and just a block down from the strip. This is my first time putting a review in and I regret that it is a negative one. This review in no way reflects on our time visiting Vegas; it is strictly regarding the hotel we chose to stay at. Recently renovated? I seriously doubt it. When I arrived to check in I was surprised at the amount of cigarette smoke in the casino lobby. Being my first time to Vegas I thought, oh, well, I guess I'd better expect that if they still allow smoking in the casinos. It was only after we had explored the next day that I realized it was not actually common for the casinos to be poorly ventilated of cigarette smoke. The room we got had plenty of room, a view of MGM Grand, and was very clean. The beds were comfortable and I slept well. The style was dated, though, and the bathroom -- again, while clean -- was in dire need of upgrading. The floor and tub were chipped and aged, some of the caulking around the showerhead was in need of replacement, and it just felt old. My friends and I had a great time in Vegas, we enjoyed each other's company and saw the sights and shows. We hope to make our visits to Vegas on a semi-annual basis. However, I for one will not be returning to Hooters when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expected, would stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: atsirkp
Reviews.Content: even after reading some bad reviews I thought I would risk it anyways. the room was clean and all the staff were extremely nice and helpful. while staying in Vegas before we have spent hours of our trip waiting for elevators, at Hooters no waiting at all. The pool is open 24 hours a day and very nice friendly security persons are around to make you feel safe when you are alone in the hot tub at 3AM. I have paid alot more for alot less in Vegas in the past

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: bbertuzzi
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. The show Purple reign was AWESOME. The coffee shop was great. And our suite was perfect, the jacuzzi spas was out of this world. We live here in Vegas and it felt like a real vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great price average room”
Reviews.Author: blazinRtires
Reviews.Content: I planned a last minuet trip to Vegas and didn't have the money to stay in a fancy suite in one of the nicer casinos. Some girlfriend of mine stayed at this hotel and described it as cheap,clean, and easy to walk to the strip. This hotel was exactly that overall I liked my room. I was nothing fancy but it had a fun beach theme and for a room under $30 it was great. I felt safe walking to the strip day and night. There is a saltwater pool that was nice. My only complaint was it said in the book in the hotel room that late check outs are not a problem because this is Vegas (meaning we understand you have been up most of the night). But when I called the front desk they could not extend my check out time or offer me another night because they where booked. So when I had to take a shower there was only ICE WATER left. I did tell the lady at the desk when I checked out and she kindly waived my resort fee. So I was happy with my stay over all.

Reviews.Title: “Hoots!”
Reviews.Author: x0bperry
Reviews.Content: I have now been to Vegas 3 times & have stayed at Hooters all 3 times. Something about the hotel to me is homey. I like the atmoshphere. The staff is always friendly. It's not a fancy hotel like the Bellagio and others but if you're looking for a cheap place to stay I would highly reccomend Hooters. It's only a few minute walk from the Strip. I've never had a problem as far as cleanliness. I love it there.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jhn35
Reviews.Content: Ok, what are you looking for? I had just finished a backpacking trip in the Grand Canyon and was trying to stay somewhere cheap for two nights while I waited for my flight home. This hotel had great rates and wings and a beer certainly didn't sound bad. To my surprise, I really enjoyed this place. Look, I have stayed at the fancy Las Vegas hotels and some not so fancy. If your interested in a glitzy Las Vegas experience, by all means, stay elsewhere. But for the money, this is a very down to earth friendly hotel. I will certainly stay here again. For the criticism I read- some of it is fair. My room was clean, but yes, it is dated, But my bed was comfortable and I had no issues with my bathroom which was a decent size. And for the money I spent on this hotel room- honestly- what are you expecting. It was light years better than it should have been for the money. I'd loved the fact that after I arrived I could go down and sit at a Hooters bar, order dinner with wings and an ice cold Drifter Pale Ale. I just wish they would have served this in a glass and not a plastic cup- but I'm sure there is a reason for this. The casino itself is small compared to any other Vegas Hotel. But this has its advantages too, as everyone is very friendly and they got to know me over the two days I spent here. If you are a serious gambler, you probably will want to play elsewhere. The blackjack rules were a little too favorable to the house, but hey, where else does a Hooters girl deal you blackjack? But the great part about this hotel is it sits directly across the street from the MGM Grand, making the strip and other casinos easily available for gambling. I enjoyed gambling at NYNY, drank a bit much, and couldn't wait to walk back to my hotel to have a serving of wings and another drifter before bed. If your OK with laid back and cheap rooms- stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Out of hot water”
Reviews.Author: ALBtrvlr
Reviews.Content: Hotel was alright, rooms were clean, beds comfortable, but where was the hot water. Took a shower in the morning and ran out of hot water....talk about a wake up. Could hear neighbors through the vents, kids running up and down hall and did call but nothing was done. Charged 8 dollar resort fee, not worth it. For $35 a night, I would probably stay again but nothing higher.

Reviews.Title: “GROSS!”
Reviews.Author: KristenL01
Reviews.Content: The rooms were far from satisfactory, very unclean, wore my flip flops in the shower _ nasty. I knew this would not be a 4 star hotel experience but I did expect it to be updated and clean. There was goo on the phone and all of the numbers and buttons were missing - I still cannot get the smell out of my purse or luggage. The pool is ok but the sun goes down behind the building so no sun after 2:30pm - 3 pm. Spend the extra $100 to $200 per night on a better spot on the strip. It felt like the ghetto

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: guy_of_gisbourne
Reviews.Content: stayed here again for 3 nights and what can you say great location 5 min walk to mgm,tropicana,new york etc.. hotel very clean a little dated but colourful and oh so cheap..$1.50 for draft bud or bottled bud all day or if your british you will prefer the other drafts at just $2.50..more taste! great servers too one young lady serving what seemed like the entire casino floor was around happily asking you if you needed drinks way before you could finish the last one! cheap and cheerful i'd stay there again no probs.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: traveler23412
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Vegas for a week long getaway. We selected Hooters as our hotel because of the location *(right across from MGM and next to Tropicana) and price. We were so pleasantly surprised to find a clean room, fun restaurants and a great casino. We also liked the Bait Shop to get our coffee each morning. The weather was a bit cooler, so we weren't able to enjoy the pool area for more than a few hours. The casino was super fun and we were upgraded to a strip view room. Great view!! Even after going out and about to other casinos, we found ourselves returning to Hooters because we loved the atmosphere the most. The price was right and the staff was nice. Each day our room was cleaned so well and restocked. The housekeeping team really did a great job!! When we return to Vegas again, we will definitely book there again!

Reviews.Title: “EWWW”
Reviews.Author: travisochoa1
Reviews.Content: I would of much rather stayed at a motel 6! this place is gross. my wife hated it. the money we saved by staying here was not worth it. do not pick this hotel thinking "we wont ever be in the room anyways" just walking to our room the couple nights we were there was enough to ruin the vocation.

Reviews.Title: “great price and location”
Reviews.Author: kellybh896
Reviews.Content: my 3yr old daughter and i where able to walk the strip no problem and back and it was great. the rooms where nice and clean and cozy. also very nice view over looking the waterfall pool. which was amazing because there where different temps in each pool so one for everyone. i recommend this hotel for family, friends, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay HERE!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiff_g_11
Reviews.Content: Upon checkin on a busy weekend we found our room was grose! Dried substances on the walls and a pool so dirty I wouldn't let my dog in it! Then to top it off we left some items in the room......they sent them out but at a $100.00 cost! The stuff wasnt even worth that much! Very dissapointing customer service as well. If u want to enjoy your stay DO NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Entertaining and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: russellensley
Reviews.Content: Me and a girlfriend stayed here from May 7 -10th. $89 for Sat night and $29 for the last two nights. The room was fine, a little dusty but nothing that would make it horrible. The Casino was relatively small, but who stays in their room in Vegas? Its basically a Hooters with a casino and a pool and bunch of bars. If you are expecting the Bellagio, well, you will be disappointed. If you are looking for a place to stay cheaply and in a good location, well this is a good fit. The crowd was younger (I'm 40) but i like the energy with the crowd. The service was either really really good, or really really bad in the bars. I have to give a shout out to our bartender Jenn. She was top notch and knew how to entertain the guests. This probably isn't for the 50+ crowd, or the arrogant traveler, but if you want to go to Vegas for fun and a good location, this is a great fit. Nothing really baudy about it all.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yamaha24
Reviews.Content: When me and my mother stayed there I had one of the maids go into my luggage. It was closed and I had an empty purse on top of it and when I went upstairs my purse was on the table and my suitcase was unzipped and opened. The manager barely did anything for us. It was a terrible stay. It ruined my holiday and you couldn't pay me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Pinkbomshell81
Reviews.Content: 1st room full of moths! 2nd room air con not working. Female pool bar staff rude. Would not stay again. Casino great nice small size. You get what you pay for I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hooters”
Reviews.Author: Scooterboy71
Reviews.Content: After our wedding a week earlier we were returning to vegas from L A. My wife and I chose Hooters as our home for the last 4 nights of our honeymoon, and how fantastic was it..! Polite, frendly staff, great room (we actually preferred the room at Hooters than our room at Excalibur) lots of space well equipped with s great view overlooking the pool area, yeah there are parts of the hotel that could do with a lick of paint and a tidy up but so what, great value for money.. Oh don't forget to try 3 mile island buffalo wings!!! We will deffinatly be going back next year...

Reviews.Title: “One word....DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: HottieChick
Reviews.Content: I've stayed all over the strip. From the Aria to the Excalibur, and this place takes the cake. First of all, we had to switch rooms 3 times because they couldn't get it right. The front desk staff were amongst the rudest most unhelpful people I've ever encountered. The craps table could only run on 1/2 a table due to lack of staff, the waitress/bartender at the pool was the only person servicing the entire pool area. The elevator had a glitch, you had to press 4 to get to the 3rd floor. The entire hotel is hot and stinks so bad it's nearly unbearable (I don't think they have the money to run the filteration system, if one even exists). This was the absolute worst stay I've ever had, anywhere. Take my advice and spend a few extra bucks and stay somewhere that isn't falling apart and has enough staff to tend to their patrons.

Reviews.Title: “hooters rocks”
Reviews.Author: luckydriver6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time at hooters. It's a small casino, so get a comp card and the free stuff adds up quick (meals, merchandise etc.). Way faster then the big hotels. It's small enough that you can go up to the room and back to the casino floor in 5 minutes. If not gambling, you can't beat $1.50 buds/bud lights. The rooms were alittle dated, but you don't spend much time in your room anyway. When you do, the beds were very very comfortable. It's only a 5 minute walk to the strip that is safe at anytime. Or cross the street and go through the mgm for the air conditioning. Alot of people in hooters are from other hotels because of the cheap beer, and better service all round. Please eat at the MAD ONION!!! The blackened prime rib is the best in vegas. My wife and I were having it for breakfast it was so good. Will recommend hooters to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Heath15
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, if you're looking for a good location and you're on a tight budget, this is your hotel! But, keep in mind it's cheap for a reason. It's a little outdated, and the rooms are average in cleanliness and quality. Next time I go to Vegas, I think I'm going to splurge on a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: farrowp
Reviews.Content: We picked Hooters as we found an excellent room deal on the internet and were only staying in Vegas for two nights for a quick look after visiting other attractions like Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam. Hooters is based on the the hooters chain which has the lovely girls in spray on shorts. these were there in abundance. rooms were clean and functional, internet which was free did not work in room. The pool lost the sun at about 3pm in afternoon due to the way it was built. This hotel has lots of gambling but is not plush. However it is perfectly located for walking the strip and poeple watching so is great for a quick visit to Vegas if thats what your there for. Parking is free but parking is not difficult in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT spot... Excellent Value!!”
Reviews.Author: OUTOFHERE291
Reviews.Content: For anyone thinking "I'm not taking my husband to Hooters"... trust me.. its not at all what you would expect... I was totally expecting to arrive there and be bombarded with... well, Hooters.. but I was very surprised.. other than a few of the table dealers, the odd waitress and in the Hooters Restaurant itself, it was very mild... My husband and I stayed at the Hooters hotel and we had a great time!! The hotel is an excellent place to stay if you are looking for an excellent value.. don't go to Hooters is you are expecting The Bellagio.... The hotel lobby is very nice and clean. The casino part is much smaller than the regular larger casinos.... Beds are super comfortable but a bit small.... bathrooms are nice and roomy and clean.. a friendly reminder to tip the maids on a daily basis or your room won't get much attention... I usually left $1 / day and the one day I forgot, we got back to the room and the only thing that was done was the bed... carpet was not vacuumed and they "forgot" to leave the towels... the pool area is very nice and if you are up for getting a tattoo, there's a tattoo shop by the pool deck and they are very good at what they do.. the price is right too!!! The Mad Onion Restaurant is AWESOME and the prices are very reasonable.. especially the breakfasts!! The Hooters Restaurant was a bit of a disappointment... we went in one evening for muchies and beer and the place was sooooo loud you could not even hear yourself think and the waitresses were not very pleasant!!! When you stay on or close to the Strip, don't except to eat for cheap... cheap meals are few and far apart... be prepared to dish out at least $40-$50 per meal.... (if you are lucky) try to find buffets or spots off the strip, still within walking distance (side streets) to find good deals.... The Stratosphere and Freemont Street have great deals on buffets!!! High speed internet was a bit confusing... they have high speed but it's not WIFI... When I plugged the laptop in, it took me to the Hooters homepage and I had to choose what option I wanted to buy.. I bought the 24 hours for $12.95.. The front desk clerk informed me that it would be charged to the room so I fully expected to see it on my bill upon check out but there was no sign of it anywhere.. so not sure if it's included in your $8 / day hotel fee but it would seem like it was... in my case anyway and I did not bother asking when I checked out... When getting around on the strip... your best value for traveling if you are not in to walking the entire strip day after day.... buy a bus pass for the Deuce bus (double decker bus) they have ticket booths set up on the strip every so many feet to buy the passes... you buy a pass and it gives you access to the Deuce bus as well as the Express bus... (pick up a bus route guide to check which bus goes where you want to go)... fyi, the Express bus is much better than the Deuce with less stops... the Deuce stops at basically every larger hotel / casino on the strip where the Express only stops at a select few... must quicker to get from one end to the other of the strip!! If you are NOT in to getting roped in to Time Share or Vacation package seminars.... do not stop to talk to people on the strip who walk out in front of you offering you free stuff.. trust me.. they are everywhere.... if you don't mind spending 2-3 hours listening to their presentations, you will walk away with free stuff... I will admit, we did 2 of these vacation package seminars and ended up with tickets to a show at the Stratosphere, 2 free buffet tickets, free passes to the Top observation deck at the Strat, tickets to Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum, 4 course Italian meal at Venetian and tickets for a gondola ride... so yeah, they may be annoying but you do get loads of good free stuff.... We only had a couple issues with the hotel which in my opinion were very minor...the first room they put us in had a safe that did not work and after 1.5 hrs of the maintenance dude trying to fix it, they moved us to another room... we had requested a room with a king size bed but when we arrived, they had none available in non smoking so we settled with the regular 2 double bed room.. Other than those 2 minor issues, the hotel itself is GREAT... Close walking distance to The Strip... maybe 5 min walk... So, if you are up for a nice, clean, very good deal in Vegas.. the Hooters Casino & Hotel is a perfect option... We LOVED our vacation and we will be returning!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just doesn't make the grade”
Reviews.Author: DonEWilliams
Reviews.Content: The cleaning staff are no hockey players. They are afraid to get into the corners. The $8 resort fee is a rip. They want a dollar for peanut butter for your toast and $4 a page to send a fax. Everything comes in plastic. I think that says it all. It is in desperate need of some TLC

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, and Convenient. Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: fairyprincess74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 4/14/11-4/19/11. We booked the hotel and flight about 16hrs before we took off on the plane. Surprise 10 yr anniversary getaway. (I picked the hotel by the way) My first time in Vegas and he hadn't been in about 19 yrs. Quick trip from airport. It says 1 block off the strip, but apparently Vegas blocks are larger than Louisiana blocks. This is not On The Strip as someone else wrote. There is a little bit of walking and crossing the street to get to the strip. Check in was quick. There is a resort fee of 7.50 per night, so drink those little bottles of water in your room. Still cheaper than some of the other hotels. We upgraded to a room with a view of the strip, and for my first time, it was worth it. Probably wouldn't upgrade again, but it was nice waking up in the am, opening the curtains, and seeing the Luxor, Excaliber, MGM, and the Statue of Liberty (New York New York). YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!! Don't expect the Bellagio for 25.00/night. Come on....I couldn't believe some of the reviews. Here's the Nitty Gritty: Beds soft, rooms clean, bathroom roomy enough, safe in room but battery didn't work, gift shops had a variety, restaraunts were good/clean/fast, pools clean but cold, plenty of lounge chairs by pool, and plenty of slots to play in casino. Internet available, but only if you pay by the day for it. No coffee pot or refrigerator in our room. I didn't know that you could go to hotel without free wifi or a coffee pot in each room. That is just Un-American! haha So here is the fix for those, free internet at the Mcdonalds on the strip. It's a little bit of a walk but you get some exercise and fresh air. There is coffee available for purchase in the downstairs giftshop, but not for me. There are a Bizzillion Star Bucks in nearby hotels. We found one at MGM that was right inside the door that we passed by everyday. Extra Shot Recommended after staying up late everynight! Life gives you lemons, Add the Tequila and Salt. Don't just complain, drink the Margarita!! Back to Hooters...Our room was cleaned everyday. I wrote on the free tablet to leave 6 washcloths and 4 bathtowels and the maid did just that. They have a sign posted about cutting down on energy and environmental pollutants by using less towels. Sorry environment, I shower when I wake up, after swimming, and have to at least was my face before I go to bed. There was one day that our bed was not changed. That was the day that my husband went back to the room for something and left my purse on the bed. I was very happy that our cleaning lady didn't touch the bed at all. I am sure it is procedure, but it made me smile. Maids get a bad wrap sometimes, and I must admit, I too hide my valuables. Everything was in the correct place, nothing missing, nothing moved. Check out easy. Cabs waiting at 6 am to take us to airport. Overall, I would stay here again. The only complaints I have are charging for the internet, no coffee pot in the room and the distance being longer than 1 block from strip. That was poor planning on my part. I could have checked it out better, but it was a last minute trip and I didn't take the time to look into these things. Like my 7 yr old says," You get what you get, and don't catch a fit.!" These were my mistakes. They do not advertise these things. I just assumed and you know the joke about assume.... I would definitely stay here again if we were looking for a quick, less expensive trip. Oh, one additional note. Next door the Tropicana is renovating, and they do start terribly early with the jackhammers and such, but that isn't Hooters problem. It's not like they can pick up and move while the construction is underway. We were on the same side as the construction, but I am an early riser anyway, so it was ok to me.

Reviews.Title: “Recycling plant outside your hotel window.”
Reviews.Author: eugeneeugeneuk
Reviews.Content: Cheap- good when price taken into account. Hot tub is not hot. Some recycling plant outside hotel window- start working 1-30 am on the dot- wear ear plugs. Casino music choice...tries to satisfy everybody and in the end annoys everybody. Staff do not really care. Otherwise, it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good rates, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: MCRD_SMP
Reviews.Content: The group sales person was super helpful and stayed with me every step of the way. While this hotel is not officially "on the strip" it is close enough to walk in moments. I could see the MGM grand from my window. The pools and casino is not as big as you would get in the massive resorts, but for the price, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters is ace !!”
Reviews.Author: AlanNorthernireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights april 2011, if you want a hotel casino expierence with fun and such a relaxed attitude hooters is the place to stay.rooms bright clean and well serviced beds very comfy.25cent chicken wings after a night out food excellent i wouldnt recomend hooters if your looking a romantic weekend but if your up for fun its the place to stay. mgm across the street crossing outside lobby tropicana hotel and casino minutes away new york new york and excalibur hotels accesable via bridges and the strip is on your door step. checking in was so easy i had problems with card to access room and the guys at hooters were so appoligetic , as for the casino fantasic i stayed at hooters for the eric morales v maideana fight in mgm at half the cost of MGM ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time!”
Reviews.Author: chrisbaxter78
Reviews.Content: This trip was a blast. Good location, friendly staff and a party environment. Best of all very cheap rates. I will be back often.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: AngB6405
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried to stay here after all the so-so reviews but but they had a special where rooms were only $20.11 so I figured I'd give it a chance and I'm so glad we did! It was a quick taxi ride from the airport and check in was a breeze. I only paid for a regular no view room but we ended up getting one with a strip view. The carpet in the room was a little stained but other than that it was nice and clean. Also the bed was very comfy! The pool area was nice and open 24 hours which was great after a long day of walking, we spent a couple of nights in the hot tub. Also the food and service at the Mad Onion was wonderful! Can't beat $9.95 Prime Rib! There were a lot of complaints about the smoke in the casino but I barely noticed it and I did not smell like smoke once I got to my room. It was off the strip a but probably only a 5 minute walk and very close to the MGM monorail station. Also a lot of people complained about the resort fee but they are very upfront about it so you know about it when you book the room and when you check in! I usually don't write hotel reviews but I really wanted to defend Hooters!

Reviews.Title: “Best vegas hotel when on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: rayandgabby
Reviews.Content: Ok so I came here on an unplanned vegas trip for a friends bday. We were booking the hotel online the same day as our stay which means everywhere was charging more than usual. We paid about ninety bucks, but I have seen this place in the thirties sometimes which is incredible. Now its one of the cheapest hotels on the strip so dont expect the luxuries a lot of em offer, but definately beats circus circus. Clean room. Decent space and imo a pretty good location. Not technically on the strip, but a vwry quick one or maybe two short blocks away. Easy access to mgm and pretty much anything on the south strip. There is a resort fee which is stupid, but cheaper than most vegas hotels nowadays. one thing I like is bud beers are $1.50 at all the bars..not bad. Only downsides a small casino that doesn't smell too great so if u dont plan on leaving your own hotel much, just splurge amd stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “The best for less”
Reviews.Author: williamrisse
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Hooters from April 5th to the 7th.2011 I was treated excelent, and the room was great. I am going to plan a July trip, and I will stay at Hooters for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great economic htoel”
Reviews.Author: James45_Orlando
Reviews.Content: The location is a centrally located in the middle of the strip. The room basically cost $30 a night. That is hard to beat, but dont expect from the room. The casino is fine, and there is a Hooters restaurant co-located in the casino. Very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected and Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: LaaLaa
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews on TA, I was extremely uneasy about our stay at Hooters, but was pleasantly surprised. We decided to stay here because it was the best price we could find and still be on the Strip. Everything worked well. The room was clean -- if you can live with the polyester bedspread. The bathroom was clean. The hotel operator was upfront about the charges for internet. We were there for one night -- St. Patrick's Day -- and the very young crowd in the hotel and casino were under control. All in all, I would do it again for price -- just don't expect the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good scrubbing and some TLC”
Reviews.Author: farmersfrommn
Reviews.Content: LACK of cleanliness in many of the public areas, the Hooters restaurant itself, and even the room. It wasn't enough to make us want to change rooms ( probably no different ) but it was "grimy" enough to make me wish I had brought my house slippers to wear in the room. We are NOT picky people, nor are we used to "5 star" accommodations but I do expect good general cleaning practices to be met. The carpets are in desperate need of a DEEP cleaning, if not a total replacement, even INSIDE the rooms ( the halls are worse ) and I basically used a towel, soap, and water and cleaned the bathroom floor myself once I was trying to get settled in. It had been "cleaned" since the last guest because it was stocked appropriately, but the bathroom floor was visibly dirty and so were the other surfaces in the room. The room had a stale smell. The bed linens "looked" clean and fresh, but I just had to assume they were and go with it. Basically, we were not very confident in the housekeeping practices of the place. The elevators were filthy, the tables and stools in the Hooters restaurant were sticky and quite banged-up. The cleanest areas were the pool and the front entrance where we saw people actually "cleaning" areas. We still enjoyed the friendly and easy check-in and the low limit tables and the cocktail service. The two husbands in our group used the hot tubs outside and we did sit by one of the "working" fire-pits while we were there, but it was definitely NOT worth the 7.50/day resort fee that is charged for these "amenities". There was kind of a "feel" about the place that it's getting a bit run-down and they are not willing to put the money into keeping it up. Like most other people say on this site, if you want an inexpensive place to stay Hooters might work for you. I feel that if they are going to continue to draw in business with their low prices and convenient location, they better concentrate on up-keep and housekeeping ( aren't there 1000's of people looking for work in LV ?) or they will not see people returning to stay at Hooters. We will be staying elsewhere next time, even for more money, in favor of a cleaner establishment. I have stayed at MUCH cleaner Days Inns or Motel 6 . I don't need anything fancy, but I DO expect it to be clean.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with housekeeping services at Hooters, Las Vegas Hotel, Bad Rating!”
Reviews.Author: sanzlizette53
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with house keeping services, of the three days only one day was serviced just because I called, otherwise it wouldn't of gotten done. Then they wanted to charge me $8 for service, which was ironic to me. After I complained, they said that they were not going to charge me the service fee. The rooms are not good quality because the air comes in through the AC unit and make a lot of noise like a banging door sound, couldn't sleep. Also, the beds have dust mites, leg irritations.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: TrishBoise
Reviews.Content: So...I had read all these reviews and was a little worried. Decided to stay here because of the great price, and we didn't want to spend an arm and a leg on a room we wouldn't be in very much. We got a great deal...I think the first night was only $20, and Fri. and Sat. were $59 each. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Now...I was there was a significant other, and neither of us are very picky. We are both in our 40's, and pretty low key. The room was clean, bed was very comfy, and the sheets were also very comfy. We had no problems. The location is great. Now, if I was there for a "girls weekend", I would probably stay somewhere else with a nicer pool, etc. But we enjoyed the low key casino, the drinks when gambling were quick, and we thought the service was great. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay at Hooters. You get what you expect from Hooters.”
Reviews.Author: BadRat
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have stayed at Hooters, Las Vegas for our annual "guy's trip" three times in the past three years and have not been disappointed. Yea, it's not the MGM, Paris, or Bellagio, but for the price, you get a decent room in a great location. On our most recent trip we arrived at 10:00am on a Sunday morning and asked the bell clerk if we could check our bags until the 3:00pm check-in. He suggested we go ahead and see if we could check in early, which we did. The room was okay, relativly clean, overlooking the pool. There was about a three inch gap between the A/C unit and the wall which allowed a lot of heat, noise and smells into the room. The casino is small and easy to navigate. No getting lost trying to find your buddies like the mega casinos. The low table minimums are great! The cocktail waitresses never let a drink get empty, and we're not big spenders or high rollers. One night we stayed up until 6:00am at one of the bars drinking for free because the bartender (who was a beautiful Hooters girl) wanted some company to move the night along. The pool area and work out room are okay, nothing special, small and friendly. They do charge an un-advertized mandatory "resort fee" of about $7.50 per day when you check in. This is not the place I take my wife when we go to Vegas, but for a guy trip Hooters is great! Save some money for gambling by staying here. You can easily walk to the bigger casinos nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Changed Since 2006”
Reviews.Author: Buckwheat77
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at Hooters in 2006 when it first opened. The room rate back then was $63 a night and we thought...it's a new hotel and we like the Hooters brand so how bad could it be? Well, it was really great to be honest! The casino was fun and lively, staff was nice and it had a Hooter's restaurant on-site, which was appropriate. The rooms were as cute as could be, mimicking the "Hooter's" restaurant decor. Beds were comfy. They had neat little ammenities in the bathroom. Good stuff. Welllll, we went back for a week in March 2011 and....things changed. The prices were still comparable to 2006, which we were excited about but the rooms weren't as nice. The beds seemed harder and the comforters weren't those nice plush ones anymore. Some of the touches in the room like the high-top table with the tin beer bucket for your ice were gone. We didn't even have a chair at the desk. The bathroom goodies were downgraded to the point they had that lousy shampoo & conditioner-in-one crap, so I had to go buy shampoo and conditioner separately (a girl thing). The thing that irked us the most was the fact that at 11 pm, we decided to have dinner and we came all the way back to the hotel from down the strip, specifically to have their Prime Rib that they advertise on the side of their building to be served 24/7. Well, this night they were cleaning their kitchen equipment so no Prime Rib. We could have eaten Prime Rib at several other places down the strip but toted our happy butts back to Hooters to eat at our hotel and go to bed. My husband threw up quite a fuss about it with the Chef at the restaurant and with the front desk supervisor because a hungry man with his mind set on Prime Rib is no lauging matter! Their sense of customer service was just lacking about the whole deal. Could have been easily solved by comping us another meal, but their offer was to comp us a Prime Rib dinner the next night, which my husband explained we wouldn't be there the following night. You'd think in the customer service industry you'd say, "What can we do to make this up to you?" But it was like, "Oh, well, you won't be here tomorrow night. We're sorry." It was just irritating at 11 pm when you're starving and there's no place close to eat. We read the next day that Hooter's Casino is on the verge of bankruptcy and hasn't been profitable since they opened, soooooo, it makes sense now. Won't be staying there again even if they do stay open.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place”
Reviews.Author: AnarKhaos
Reviews.Content: I was at Hooters for a long weekend with friends and I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is nice and cozy and the staff is friendly. Also the location is good, very close to MGM, New York, Excalibur and other hotels. The room was clean and enough spacious. The food at restaurants ok, it would be nice to have some light options, though. The casino is all right, with very low minimums and a great offer on Bud and bud light, at casino bars. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: johnrsh
Reviews.Content: Dont be lured in by the price!!! This hotel leaves a LOT to be desired!! The rooms were dirty. Accidentally took the service elevator once and found it filthy with dirt and food caked in the corners and smelly.The safe in our room was broken and after 3 technicians and still not fixed has to change rooms. The casino was run down and in desperate need of updating. My husband was charged $7.00 for a Bloody Mary while gambling. The restaurant was overpriced and not very good. We will never stay here again and would never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for but not going to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Canadians002
Reviews.Content: We got what we paid for. Wasn't expecting much for only paying $24/night but I was expecting a little more than what we got. The bathroom smelt like eggs when we flushed the toilet. The water was either extremely cold or extremely hot. Couldn't take a comfortable shower because of that. The A/C and Heater was LOUD. There wasn't a coffee maker and our sheets had black stains on them (looked like ink marks) We did not get any extra blankets so we froze at night and had to turn on the loud heater and wear ear plugs to dim the noise. The hot tub was nice but did not like how there was a security guard in one of the rooms 10 floors up watching us out the window. Not a place to go to go to a pool unless it's hot out. The employees (yes even the hooter girls) were so rude our entire stay. Checking in/out was very slow as well. Like I said we got what we paid for, but to me that price in the end was not worth it. We'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else! Love this Place!”
Reviews.Author: carlos_chavez
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying check in was a breeze. The staff was friendly and the customer service was outstanding!!! The rooms were great and very clean! The food was outstanding and the beer was delicious and COLD!! The best part of my trip was when I won a CAR!!!!!! I've been to Vegas many times and this was the best stay so far. from the cold beer to winning a brand new car I couldnt have asked for a better trip!

Reviews.Title: “Casino ok, Room nice, Hooters Restraunt NASTY!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. We got excellent customer service from the bell desk and registration desk. THe big fat dude at the Owl Rewards desk was a total JERK, it is obvious he hates his job. He was curt, snippy and plain ol RUDE!! The Mad Onion has great late night eats. The on location Hooters is NO GOOD. Our wings were greasy, greasy, nasty. No flavor and we ended up kinda sick over them. So stay here, play somewhere else and def only eat at the Onion :)

Reviews.Title: “Hooters Hotel and Casino is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: johnnyho26
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for my bachelor party and I couldn't be happier with my experience at Hooters. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly. The food was great and all of the employees went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable. I will definitely stay at Hooters Hotel and Casino on my next trip to Vegas! My friend also won a car at Hooters so you can't top that! Thanks Hooters staff for making our trip relaxing, fun and extremely enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “heed my warning”
Reviews.Author: 00jakeg00
Reviews.Content: We aren t better than anyone else, but take the money spent on one hour of slots, and upgrade to ANY other hotel on or near the strip. The 1.50 beer wasn't cold, the casino is run down and neglected, the rooms are trashed. This place is downright filthy. One morning someone puked off the balcony and there it layed, right next to all the beer cans and trash on top of the casino. That was our Bayview tower view. Anyhow, all the adjacent casinos accomodated our entertainment, food, and cleanliness setbacks that Hooters provided. The reviews are all bad for a reason, unless your a young punk kid that thinks everyone wants to hear how super cool you are, or have never cared about small stuff like clean carpet, glass,walls,tubs,toilets you'll fit right in at Hooters.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain priced Gem that is underrated”
Reviews.Author: Mazonthemove
Reviews.Content: I was tempted to give this a bad review to keep secret what a great deal you get at Hooters! OK it's not the luxury of the Venetian or Caesars Palace, but hey. I paid £24 a night plus resort fee & tax = $35 for a room with a pool view, two queen size beds, Bud at $1.50 a bottle & free coffee cos I bought a $5 mug. I left $1 a day tip for the maid & my room was immaculate. I found all the staff were friendly when treated with respect, I guess they just get too many people who expect Bellagio standard for a Circus Circus price (man, that is a dump) I stayed 4 nights in February and will go back again in Aprli.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTraveler22
Reviews.Content: Yes, stay at Hooter's!! Not only is it a fun place to hang out, there is cheap beer- $1.50 Bud Light!!! We had a great time here, thanks mostly to Steve...our favorite bartender. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice and the pool is super (even though it was too cold to swim).

Reviews.Title: “Was fun and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: unlvdude0040
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tacky like the restaurant but so much fun. The staff is pleasant and fun. The food is good and not overly priced and close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Nic029
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at Hooters for 4 nights at the end of January. We paid $25 per night and were a bit worried from the photo's of the rooms on line that they might be dirty but for the price we thought we'd give it a try. We were really impressed with the room. We had a room over looking the pool with 2 Queen beds. The beds were clean and comfortable and the bathroom was clean with a good shower and plenty of hot water. The decor is a bit off putting in the photo's but don't let it put you off if you can get a good rate as the rooms are very clean and comfortable. We would definately stay there again (and trust me I'm fussy). The only downside was the smoke in the casino area as by the time you had walked from your room to outside your clothes did smell of smoke which isn't nice but it definately wasn't bad enough that it would put me off staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY I PAID!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lawman2021
Reviews.Content: On February 12, 2011, I stayed at your hotel (Hooters). Upon me entering the front door, i was not impress. The atmosphere was very depressing and full of cigarette smoke. I paid a total of $138.00 for a one bedroom (1 night). During my stay, i parked my car outside in the rear parking lot area. I have never seen so much security patroling the grounds of a hotel. It looked light something you would see in a run down motel located in the worst area you could imagine. When i attempted to use your elevator the entire buttons (use for going up and down were missing-5th floor). As i went to my room, i notice a very large "BLOOD' stain on the carpet!!!!!. While walking around the employees are hitting on the guess. The hotel was far from being clean....and when i went to go check out as around 8am, my total bill came to $168.00. The receptionist informed me of a luxury tax (water in my room; use of the pool; and for providing security). When i heard this, i had to laugh in disbelief!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I am almost certain that i will not be the last person and/or the first to have complained about this place.....what a big disapointment to say the least!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury for Less”
Reviews.Author: webco317
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite sure what people are expecting of a hotel that charges $20 or less a night, but I was super impressed. I stayed in an "ocean view" room which reminds me of a resort room in Myrtle Beach. Very nice, new wood furnishings, beach scenes hanging on the walls, tropical decor and bedding, nice pool view.... There are even "wet feet" footprints inside the elevator that look real.. I felt like i was near the ocean... There were a few cosmetic maintenance problems on the hotel grounds, but nothing to really complain about... My hotel room was clean and they even let me check in an hour and a half early... The Mad Onion restaurant offers a $9.95 prime rib, mashed potatoes, corn, and jalapeno corn muffin... I was shocked at how good it was.. I'm very picky about my cuts of meat... but this was excellent.. It literally melted in my mouth and there was almost nothing left on my plate... The Hooters restaurant inside is just a typical Hooters... Slots here are pretty tight and the casino isn't huge... To sum up... if you are looking for a nice, clean, and comfortable inexpensive hotel in vegas.. this is the place.. If you are looking for a Bellagio or MGM Grand type hotel for these prices, good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Hooters - it's not what you think; it's better !”
Reviews.Author: AuntyJ
Reviews.Content: Hooters is for everyone; I know the restaurant's reputation can put some people off - but give Hooters a chance. The hotel is nice, the location is great, the gambling is much more reasonable & less stressful than the mega-casinos, everyone's nice & helpful; especially Heather :) I can't tell you how much it means to me to walk in & be remembered. Heather always greets me with a smile; she's kind, efficient & is to be commended on her customer service skills. Thank you Heather & Hooters - see you soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Fees, Fees , Fees for no added amenities with misleading billing.”
Reviews.Author: bonte1
Reviews.Content: Resort fee for WHAT? Don't be misled by Advertised freebies that have no real value. Billing at Checkout is itemized with no description and is very confusing. I was overcharged $400+ and they don't answer phone in billing department when I called to dispute. I am still waiting on call return after 3 days and numerous calls. Stay here if you want to add stress to your life.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, Best Deal on the Strip !!”
Reviews.Author: roofcat45
Reviews.Content: This has t be the best value and the friendliest hotel on the strip !!. We found the rooms to be excellent value and the service extremely friendly and prompt. All the cocktail waitresses remembered our drinks and the dealers were very nice and friendly as well. This is definitely the place to stay as it is very affordable, the pool is excellent and atmosphere rocks !!.. Also check out the sleepy lagoon tattoo parlor off the pool area, A.J. does the best work in town and VERY affordable. We will be back and the only place we will stay is Hooters !!

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back in March!”
Reviews.Author: ImpactSafety
Reviews.Content: We have visited Vegas 6 times in 30 months and have stayed at Hooter's each time. Super people (thanks for everything Faye), great food and service at the Mad Onion, rooms are large, clean and well kept. The only recommendation would be to open additional tables earlier to give people a chance to play. Match play coupons for returning guests would be great as well. We will be back March 3 - 9, 2011 and are really looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel in las vegas”
Reviews.Author: paradisemoonlight
Reviews.Content: this is a trailer trash hotel with scary ghetto parking. for a minute i thought i was on the bad side of compton. our room was on the 3rd foor. the heater was not working n it as so cold. there was no blanket, just a sheet with a cheap out of porportion comforter. it as already midnight n we were so cold. our mind and body jumped into a survival mode. we search our bags for anything warm to wear for the night. my husband wore two t-shirts while i wore a fleece jacket. we couldnt sleep because it was cold n there was the heater noise from the other room. the noise was so loud n my husband kept waking up to ask me what it was n i kept asking if he was doing fine with the coldness. it was so sad that we stayed at hooters. felt like were were stuck in the snow with no gears. regret that we didnt bring our mini emergency fleece blacket with us. the employee are very unexperience with booking shows. we book for a show with hooters to be played at the mgm n didnt go smoothly. the employees r nice, but it is not worth going back to hooters. nothing in the room is nice. everything old n broken or out of date like from the 70's. i recommend to bring blankets if staying at this hotel n book your tickets directly with the show or at the hotel where the show will be at. bath tub is short n ugly. we skip the shower n left early the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gotan116
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend. Heater in room inoperable, burnt out light bulbs in lamps, missing TV remote. Overall condition of room was grundgy and cheap. Rooms need major renovation. Not the quality I'd expect for a Las Vegas based hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Shawny32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a great weekend in Vegas! We were going to the Weezer concert at the Hard Rock, and decided to stay at the Hooters Hotel because of the price, and close proximity to the concert venue. For a no frills hotel, Hooters was clean, the staff was super friendly, and the tables and slots were lucky :) The only issue I had was the shower took a long time to heat up. However, my husband never experienced the same problem, so just give yourself plenty of time if you want a hot shower.

Reviews.Title: “Trailer trash hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rostan1
Reviews.Content: This hotel leaves a lot to be desired for a supposed 3 star hotel. Let me start at the lobby. As is typical at some Las Vegas casino hotels you walk in the door and you're in the casino. No problem except that the Pergo type floor is cracked and chipped. The rest of the lobby and all the rooms are decorated in "early cheap" with walls and mouldings decorated in knotty pine. Once in our room while taking a shower the hot water knob fell off then while closing the drapes the rod came off in my hand. We left the handle in the tub and the rod on the DIRTY carpet in front of the drape. We hoped that the maid would contact maintenance and have the problems corrected. For the next 2 days the rod remained on the carpet and the knob kept reappearing on the faucet and then falling off while we showered. The first day we went to the unheated pool we were provided towels (more like rags) the size of face towels for our usage. What we really needed was something much much larger to cover the filthy cushions. The next day at the pool there were NO towels available. It seems the security guard was in charge of pool towels and he hadn't ordered them from Mission supply. He did eventually find us a couple of room towels for use. (My wife made the mistake of entering the hot tub and has since developed a rash over large parts of her body.) After going to our room on day 3 we found there was no hot water. I called Housekeeping/Engineering and let ring - no answer. I then called the operator and asked for the manager, the phone rang and again there was no answer. I then called the front desk and was shunted to some low level manager (this on a holiday weekend). He offered to move us and gave us a $25 credit. At this point we had had it with Hooters and moved to a different hotel. At checkout, this manager charged us $8.40 per day resort fee. When asked what was included in this so called resort fee, we were told the fee was for the pool and its amenities (unheated, contaminated hot tub, no towels and filthy cushions), the toll free LOCAL calls, and the two 8oz bottles of Hooters brand water. We paid this "extortion under protest. My advice stay far far away from this place. There are many other hotels in the area at the same or better pricing. PS - We also ate at the Sports bar/snack bar. Don't!! The food is less than mediocre, overpriced the fries are limp and soggy.

Reviews.Title: “trying to appeal to illiterate neanderthals”
Reviews.Author: nottoohardtoplease
Reviews.Content: the room is OK (the bed was comfy), but the casino, restaurants and in particular the staff and just sad. trying to get the internet fixed in the room was frustrating and ultimately unsuccessful. the toilet wouldn't flush, and they couldn't get it fixed. REALLY. the restaurant was poor, the gambling terrible. busts do not a hotel/casino make - someone should tell the manager!

Reviews.Title: “Simple , but comfty”
Reviews.Author: Miaa2008
Reviews.Content: Its not your snobby @$$ place.Very simple, but relaxing... Not bad at all. Love all the tv screens, got to watch all football games while gambling. Great Pool, Fire pits and gym .. Great price on beer and food. I cant wait until next Vegas trip. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “There's a lot good, a little bad, and some ugly”
Reviews.Author: TBROBINSON
Reviews.Content: We had to make a last minute trip to Las Vegas for the CES show and of course everything was booked, so I grabbed our group rooms here. I was very very leery of the hotel, but we could not sleep on the street and I wanted a hotel on the CES shuttle route. Arriving late we were cheerfully greeted by the manager who chatted us up while she gave us our rooms. It took maybe 10 minutes to check us in. They have limited space for check in so if a big group comes it could take awhile. The rooms are large, and I have to admit are kept very clean by the staff. They do a good job at that, and keeping the towels / toiletries / water supplied. The carpet, paint and bathroom are very tired and need to be refreshed. I kind of liked the style of the furnishings, but I am a glass half full kind of guy. The attitude of the staff was incredibly good. That was in contrast to other mega resorts I typically stay here in LV where there can be a coolness factor attitude by the staff. From the barmen to the staff in the casino everyone was friendly and willing to help. The gym is a hidden gem. It is small, but I don't think that many people come to LV to work out. I LOVED it and the pool area was inviting. However it is January so no chance to use it and generally was closed. I noticed they kept the hot tub going in the cold which I thought was decent of them. If you are a business traveller a couple of issues that I had. 1. The "desk" working area is not really comfortable for cranking that late night spreasheet. 2. The internet was a disaster. Came and went, and they charge $14.00 per day. Really? Also service came and went, and it seems the service provider had capacity issues, I was always getting bumped out and having to log back in which was bad. Some good things for business travellers. 1. You are close to MGM and its restaurants and stuff. 2. You are close to the monorail if you need to go the convention center. 3. The taxi line is not that long, and that is during an incredibly large convention. 4. This is a real active casino soooo its noisy and smoky. 5. Restaurant service is SLOWWWW in the early am to get seated. They evidently do not bring in the service staff until 9am. So before that you can wait 30 minutes for a table. In speaking with alot of people there, this seems to be a common complaint. You should try to negotiate free internet and get the coffee mug included which entitles you to free coffee all the time you are here. While it seems a small thing, if you come from a different time zone its nice to wake up at 4am and be able to get fresh hot coffee, and usually a smile from the attendant. In sum for business travellers there is good and not so good, but overall I would do it again since we are very budget concious. For the average consumer, depends on what you want, if you want a base that is not expensive, well located, I can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Crusty, Old, Bad Bad Service, Expensive Drinks! Do not STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: cklizabeth
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for my friend's wedding, there was 22 of us who stayed at Hooters. We were all very excited to stay, and when we walked in the front lobby ( where there was nowhere to sit down, nobody offered to help with luggage) we only got looked at from the not so pleasant hooter's girls that were bartending. Since it took 35 minutes to check in, we decided to get a drink at the bar. $7 beer, way too much for the atmosphere at this place. There was black hairs in our room when we finally got our keys to work (out of our 10 rooms, 6 keys didnt work!) we had to go up and down 3 times for 1 room's key to work. This is when we figured out the elevator was messed up, it took us to floor 3 when we pushed 2! We asked for new blankets on the bed and they came a half hour later. not so speedy service. front desk people were rude when we called and asked for anything. The food at the restaraunt was bad! outdoor bar wasn't open when they said it was going to be when we booked, you had to run all the way to the front lobby to get a drink. ridiculous and dirty! we are going back to vegas in march and there's no way we would ever stay there again!!!!!!! serious updates needed

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick Vegas weekend”
Reviews.Author: queenrobot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. I had read the reviews so I knew what to expect. Check in was slow but it was a Saturday afternoon and there was a huge crowd in front of us. The rooms were spacious as well as the bathroom. The only real complaint of the room was the nasty carpet that was stained and damp and musty. The view from my room sucked, it overlooked the employee smoking area and grease traps but I attribute that to using a discount site to book. We loved the casino because they have some good slots and it is small enough to not get lost. The food at the Mad Onion is pretty good and affordable. The pool area is great! We actually chose this hotel based on the fact that the pool was open 24 hours a day. I loved the waterfall and the way it is enclosed in the back of the property. I am going back here in March and hopefully we will get a pool view room. But, I am excited to have as much fun at this hotel as I did last time.

Reviews.Title: “Awful stay, ruined my whole trip”
Reviews.Author: hvm69
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 12/31-1/5. There for NYE so it was NOT cheap even. I'm not one to expect a lot from Hotels like this, I mean it may not have been cheap but this wasn't a 5 star resort either. I do however expect things like a draining tub, heat, etc.... I'm not one to write a review to complain about little things that weren't perfect, we had no intentions of perfection when we booked this trip, but what we had was miserable by the end of the trip. From the 1st day the TV remote did not work and the shower did not drain, we left a note for the maid the next morning and a tip. They had no problem taking the tip but nothing was fixed. The heat was a MAJOR issue - you have to understand this was what we were told one of the COLDEST winters they have seen in Vegas - the 1st 2 days it was super hot in the room, it was hot or cold, no ability to regulate but we could live with that. By day 3 the heat completely stopped working, none, in fact cold air was coming into the room through the unit (again coldest Vegas winter). So I asked the front desk to take care of the heat, shower, and tv. Come back later at night, nothing. No note, message, etc saying it could not be fixed and nothing was fixed. I again asked the front desk to take care of it the next day and again we were ignored. So all said and done we spent 3 nights in the room w/ no heat during one of the coldest spells in Vegas ever and I end up taking pneumonia home as a souvenir. Thus it really ruined the trip. Yes I supposed I could have gone down and complained, yelled, etc and what? then get a response and maybe get moved to another room that from what I read on other reviews probably will have similar issues but the point is I shouldn’t have to raise a stink to get something looked at with the room....Especially heat when it's cold out!!!! I don’t care if I ask the maid, front desk, doorman, etc, I don’t care who I ask to get something with the room fixed nor how big or small the issue is... they should take it to the proper person and get it resolved or advise you they can not fix it and move you....Especially at NYE rate prices!!!! Obviously that is not how Hooters operates this establishment and once they get your money they really don't care if you have an issue because mine went completely unacknowledged. The sad part is I really did like the location, the casino, restaurants and the bar/wait staff were excellent. The entertainment offerings were decent and they had some good players club promos. It could have been a great trip and excellent review but the lack of attention to resolve our issues ruined everything and literally made me sick!! In addition they also charge like a $8.50/ day resort fee for things like the pool (which you couldn't use unless you were a polar bear), 2 small bottles of water in your room, etc. not well worth it by any means.

Reviews.Title: “hooters suck!”
Reviews.Author: nellie1977
Reviews.Content: i went to stay at hooters over the NYE weekend. we checked in on dec 31st.The hotel ventilation was bad alot of smoke.Hotel is nasty and dirty. Sink and tub kept cloggin up everytime we used it. I asked one of the staff members if they could warm up my son's food and they refused. No microwave or fridgein the room. Vent had so much dust in them it looked like it had not been cleaned since 1994...F00d was ok, heater sucked, you had to keep it on all night to stay warm.Particals were flying out of the heater. Elevator that led to the garage looked a dirty back ally.I WiLL Never stay here again.If you have babies def dont stay here....yuck!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location!”
Reviews.Author: TruBluTravel
Reviews.Content: Tru Blu Travel brought in a large group for the MAACO Bowl and when it was over I sent out a survey to our group asking them what they thought about the trip. So far I have had 100% good response about Hooters Hotel Casino! If you are looking for price over luxury this is the place for you! The rooms are cozy and quiet and the hotel is in a very convient location just a minute walk to the strip! The group sales department is good to work with but the front desk needs a little training in customer service which is why I gave a low score in service. The workout room is nice and the pool area is great! Overall we had a great experience and look forward to a return trip in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you're money is low”
Reviews.Author: GardenaJoe
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute room for the Labor Day weekend here at Hooters LV. Check in was fast, then we head to the room waaaay in the back of the casino. The elevator looks beat up but I think that's the look they're going for. Get off the elevator a the first thing I notice is how hot it was, as I look to the left I see an old A/C propted in the window dripping water. Anyway I open the room door and a stale smell hits me. The room seemed clean, I think the carpet was just done. The bed was to bouncy too. Later that night I was going to self park my Escalade, it was closer to the room than Valet was. When I pulled to the side I see some gang type fellas hanging out. So I Valet it anyway. Few days later at Check out Bellman said only one Bellman and one Valet was on duty. An hour later my Wife and I had brought our own luggage down from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hooter's was awesome!! It's always the perfect place.”
Reviews.Author: lodellaz
Reviews.Content: Hooter's provides a small, but fully loaded casino. It's got great bars, a few clubs and wonderful restaurants. Everything is right there- and priced right!! The rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel is located

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Hooters Hotel absolutely RUINED my holiday!”
Reviews.Author: JTvancity
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at Hooters Hotel in Las Vegas. I have never had such a terrible experience in my entire life, and I am very well traveled... and been to Vegas many, many times. I booked a standard room, so I knew before going that it wouldn't be super luxurious by any means.... while sleeping on my first night, I was rudely woken up by loud noises in the room next to me.... it wasn't partying by others - rather, it was construction in the room next door, which began at approx 8am!!! For the first 20 mins, all I could hear was probably about 6 men (the construction workers) yapping in Spanish before they actually got to work and began ripping up the carpets, moving beds... basically making a TON of noise. The walls were incredibly thin, so it sounded like they were right in my room! I called the front desk, where a lady said she would look into what was going on and call me back. After enduring 20 mins of more noise, she never called me back. I called her back and asked WTF is the noise about? She said they were renovating the room and HUNG UP on me! I was pretty PO'd at how she spoke to me, so I went downstairs to speak to her supervisor. Her supervisor apologized and moved me into a suite away from the construction...... this is where things really get brutal..... I move to the suite upstairs, unpack all my stuff (remember, this is at about 8am...) and lay down on my bed.... and I feel a DRIP OF WATER hit me! I look up and realize that water is dripping thru the ceiling!!! I moved the bed and put a bucket under the drip and tried to get some sleep.... woke up a few hrs later, went out for the day/night.... returned to the room in the evening and was blown away to see WATER POURING thru the ceiling now! I had to change rooms AGAIN! My 3rd night in my 3rd room was (thankfully) rather uneventful... The third room I was in had old food left in the fridge, but I managed to just keep it closed and ignore it. I was so fed up at this point. I stayed in and caught up on sleep (because I was so exhausted from the chaos from the 2 prior nights) and this essentially had me waste my last night in Vegas. I am back home in Vancouver from my "vacation" which really wasn't much of a vacation at all. I was extremely upset that my Vegas holiday went like this and Hooters Hotel is solely to blame. The rooms were absolutely horrible, noisey, and leaking tons of water..... and to top it all off the staff was rude to me and never offered me any real compensation or apology. Not only will I never go back to a Hooters restaurant or hotel, but I will tell all my friends and family to avoid this dump like the plague that it is. Seriously, what kind of hotel puts you right next to construction..... then when you complain, they move you to a room with a waterfall pouring onto the bed? Never again. Never.

Reviews.Title: “Your staff sets yourself apart from your competitors ... and the check-in staff makes me never want to stay ever again!”
Reviews.Author: dinals
Reviews.Content: My friend and I (each had our own room) took a weekend trip from NY to LV and decided to stay at Hooter's, first time for each of us. Our flight was delayed from New York into Vegas because of the weather so we didn't actually arrive in to the hotel until 130-ish am. Late checkin out 2am so we still had time. The plus side about arriving so late, there should be very little wait to check in, right? It was a 6 hour flight and given the time difference, I was ready just to hop in bed. Of course, that didn't happen. My friend's name was not in the system and the check in staff wouldn't do anything about it even though we had the paperwork from Expedia!!! The only thing they'd do was to charge her the rate of the room that night until they could find the reservation in the morning? HELLO!?!!? WTF. We already prepaid! Plus, why would we need another room if I had one, right? Why would I not let my friend who travelled with me stay if there was an issue instead of paying for another room, right? You know what the lady said to me. Well, it wouldn't be fair to you because you paid for the room and she's getting a "free" stay? Cheap friends? Weird. The room situation was finally resolved by us calling Expedia (not the hotel) and waiting at the front desk while they spoke to them in person. It was a huge mess that took way longer than it should have. For the price we paid and location, I'd would totally stay there again if I didn't have an issue with the people we came in contact with initially. It was a bad first impression and unfortunately, those last awhile especially with alot of choices within a bird's eye view of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jdny33
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, eating establishments are delicious and affordable. Not many places where you can get a $9.95 Prime Rib dinner at 4am after gambling. Visit the Mad Onion and try the jalapeno corn muffin

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CipherX
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel 4* based on value, this hotel is clearly not a 4* hotel. Pro's Great location, very close to the MGM and Las Vegas Blvd 24 hour Pool & Hot Tub Reasonably comfortable beds Fun atmosphere Cheap Rates!! Con's Small issues with my room however they were all rectified - (safe didn't work, shower wouldn't drain) No blanket on bed other than unwashed bedspread $7.50 resort fee does not include internet! I would definitely stay there again just based on the cost

Reviews.Title: “If I wasn't staying for free, I wouldn't be staying here at all”
Reviews.Author: SPGPlatHick
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to tell you to stay away from this place. While I don't think it's a place for me, I also wonder who they are marketing to. What age demographic? What income level? What type of casino players? Before I review the hotel portion, All I can say is that I would not be that person in any of those questions I asked. Onto the hotel portion: What can I say? You get what you pay for. In this case, this was a free stay, and that's why I put the value on five, or else it would have been a one. I'll start from when we arrived at the hotel: 1. (Read this only if you plan on having a car, and plan on self-parking) When you drive on E Tropicana Ave, you'll see the hotel, and will start looking for parking signs. The valet sign is very prominent, but you'll have to slow down to see the signs for self-park. Once you know to turn the corner for self park, you'll find another sign that tells you to turn into a drive way... a very dark and secluded driveway at night. It almost looks like a delivery entrance. You'll pass the Hooters bungalows before you make a turn again towards the garage. It seems like an insecure area as there was a homeless person hanging out between some parked cars. Once you reach the parking structure, it gets better. We park on level 3, and head towards the elevators. When you press the down button on any of the two elevators, the lights do not light up. After waiting a minute or so, you begin to think that maybe the elevators are out. Wrong, the down buttons to the Casino are BROKEN! You need to press the up button, and either ride up with someone or be fortunate to go down after the elevator comes. There is only one elevator shaft working when I got there as the other one was in repair. This means one elevator is serving 8 floors of parking! 2. Once you reach the casino floor, you have to maneuver around the Owl Rewards Club service area with all your luggage as there isn't much space for the service line, and you all passing through. 3. The check-in was smooth and emotion-less, so I have no opinions here. The only thing interesting was that the check-in person told me the rooms were renovated 4-6 months ago. Either she was mistaken, or just plainly lied. 4. The room... oh boy the room. The heater is so old and loud and turns on and off so often that it wakes you up from sleeping. This should be the ultimate reason not to stay here if you think you'll get some sleep (I just turned it off in the middle of the night and slept close to my wife. Baby had a thick blanket that we brought). The rooms are not renovated because there are snags in the carpet, the furniture are worn, and the bed is super soft. If you like to sleep warm, don't expect a warm comforter, and you'll need to ask for an extra blanket rather than finding a blanket in the closet. IF YOU HAVE A BABY, and ask for a crib, it's a pack n' play that doesn't come deployed, you need to do it yourself. The pad was disgusting with stains, and we got extra sheets to cover the pad. The bathroom sink and shower drains very slow, and the shower is such a water miser, that you might prefer to take a bath. Last but not least... old school TVs. Long story short, I think if I was really budget minded, and had a car, I would stay at TripAdvisors #2 Vegas hotel: The affordable Staybridge Suites. There are pros and cons to this hotel. To summarize: Pros: - Relatively close to the Strip for budget minded visitors. - Hooters wings - Doesn't smell - complementary bottled water in rooms Cons: - Self parking not convenient - Hotel rooms needs major refurbishment - Carpets and bathrooms floors need to be cleaned better - Dust coated fake plants in room (Beware if you have allergies) - Pay internet

Reviews.Title: “A bit scuffed up, but a great value”
Reviews.Author: rasmith59
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I've stayed at HHC. The last two times I checked in at another hotel and moved to Hooters mid-vacation. The atmosphere is casual/tropical the casino is well lit, staff friendly. My room was clean and nicely furnished. The pool and gym are open 24/7. If you buy a mug in the gift shop you get unlimited free coffee. The internet is Ethernet provided so I bring a wireless hub with me and place it by the window so I can work down by the pool. (My trips to Vegas are a mix of business and pleasure, so I am looking for a place I can sit outside and work on my laptop.) Mid-week it is quiet. (I was the only person in the pool.) I wouldn't recommend any of the restaurants. If you do eat there, buy your beer for $1.50 in the bar and bring it with you to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but deferred maintenance has been deferred too long.”
Reviews.Author: AGuyFromArizona
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for the Rock n Roll Marathon for two nights, and wanted something fairly cheap that was close to the start at Mandalay Bay. I wasn't too concerned about quality, because I only planned on sleeping there. The price was much better than the big names on the strip.
