He was rude and abrupt. Off to the room, the elevator for which was hard to find. This place has deferred maintenance way too long. Creaky elevators, dirty floors, walls badly in need of complaint. Room heater/air conditioner rattled and clanked the whole time. Maid was very rude and grouchy when I asked for extra towels (2 towels for 2 people isn't much). Never anybody at the Bell Capt/Concierge desk. Want to print out your airline boarding pass? No problem, just go to the computer terminal by the bar and pay $5-to print out a pass? Give me a break. Forget the noise complaints-this is Vegas and people just party a lot. No problem, but this place is dirty, run down, and awful. NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Hooters”
Reviews.Author: MsCali777
Reviews.Content: Nice Rates, walking distance to the strip. Nice sized pool with an outside bar

Reviews.Title: “New Years iin Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KristinaL3
Reviews.Content: Great rate, great food and very nice rooms. So close to the strip a short walk and your there! Love it and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “watch out”
Reviews.Author: queensheep
Reviews.Content: i stayed at hooters and as i went to check out i was told there was a 8.50 fee a night per room . we had no idea of it. i think everyone should be told up front about the fee.ive read alot of reviews about hooters and 48 out of 50 we not good. we had no problems except the fees.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Easy012
Reviews.Content: My wife had a good time and enjoyed our stay with Hooters very much. My only complaint is I had the breakfast buffet at the Mad Onion. Every item I tried was cold, when I mentioned this to the waitress she checked with the person who was doing the buffett and was told everything was working OK. I know that buffets are not easy to do and keep items hot but I expected them to be at least warm. Some of the bartenders seemed to be more concerned with visiting instead of taking care of the patrons. Thank you, Larry Clark

Reviews.Title: “The little secret of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kisslev
Reviews.Content: The only qualm I have with Hooter is the fact that you charge facility fee that includes swimming in winter. You could have made a gesture and provided a substitute option, equal in value, that would have won the hearts of your guests. Why, in the world, a seventy five old lady would care to use your weights room, especialy if she has arthritis. Think about it, a 15 min internet time, for instance, to check for mail and important messeges would have done wonder to your "out of the box" image. Thanx, and Best of Wishes

Reviews.Title: “NOT VISITOR FRIENDLY!!!”
Reviews.Author: kevvopm
Reviews.Content: After arriving at this hotel and showing my paper work that my stay was paid in full the supervisor and desk clerk refuse to let me check in un less i gave them a 200.00 caash deposit or 75.00 off of my credit card. This was a hidden fee that i knew nothing about and the 3rd party company that i booked this trrip with knew of no known fee. Needless to say they would not let me check in unless i paid those fees and left me out on the street 1515 miles away from home with no place to stay and did not care and was very very rude to me and the agent that i booked with. Iwould not reccomend this hotel for any one to stay not unless they do their homework and find out about all of their hidden fees.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to return”
Reviews.Author: herculesdesonora
Reviews.Content: The rooms were simple but clean. The staff went out of their way to accomadate me. I travel 4 times a year to Vegas and I am going to consider Hooters my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “I'm never going there again.”
Reviews.Author: langbergc
Reviews.Content: First the nights where horrible..drunk people screaming out side my door both nights and then i had to pay more for the rooms that they told me..so i'm never going there again and i'm not going to recomended to my friends actually i'm going to tell them the truth.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the "resort fee" added to your bill after reserving!”
Reviews.Author: rolfline
Reviews.Content: On checking in, the bill had an $8.50 resort fee added on which was never mentioned on the booking engine. I hate deceptive practices like that! The room was OK. Probably worth what we paid anyway. Negatives were the water didn't drain out of the old tub. Stained and old bathroom floor. Too soft beds with comfortors that slid off. Positives, cheap yet quiet. Just a place to sleep, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant time............”
Reviews.Author: ukpacker
Reviews.Content: great location, great hotel. would go back to hooters

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service, unclean bathrooms - blood on the door frame!”
Reviews.Author: Casey L
Reviews.Content: While cheap and close to the Strip, this place is a nightmare. We weren't allowed to check into the room until 4 PM, the concierge took 20 minutes to even show up at his desk to take our bags, the bathroom was dirty and had zero hot water, room service that took 2 hours to arrive (and the food was terrible), the bed was uncomfortable, and the highlight - blood on the bathroom door frame. Hotel staff was ZERO receptive to our complaints. This is truly the Las Vegas Hotel from Hell.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bert14
Reviews.Content: I will start with the staff was friendly - from there I was rather let down. I would rate the establishment at just above a stay at a motel 6. The housekeeping service started at 8:45 and continuously knocked until I got up to ask them to come back later - guess I would recommend using the "do not disturb sign". The food was far from any Hooters restaurant I have eaten at. The overall look and feel of the hotel and rooms was a let down in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A quick fun getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Mpoki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just flew in fro two nights for a quick getaway. I stayed at Hooters due to the great rate I got from there website. I was unsure what I was going to be getting for the money I spent, but as soon as we walked in we were excited. All of the staff were helpful and so very nice. The hotel had a nice laid back feel, which was so perfect for a quick vacation. The room was great, I am a non smoker and there was no smoke smell. Which was so nice. I will be coming back to stay, and will be recommending this hotel to all of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Hooters is just not that great”
Reviews.Author: Hisblue
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas from Feb 14 to the 17th. I had stayed at this casino when it was the San Remo Hotel. I wish it was the San Remo hotel. The only bright spot was the food @ Hooters, The rooms where noisy and not very clean. The hallways were filthy dirty. The staff seemed to be distracted and did not really care. I understand why now they are selling the entire company. If you like dirty rooms, stay @ Hooters.

Reviews.Title: “good value just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: seacat123
Reviews.Content: Checked in early and got a room on 3rd floor and found that the balcony lock was broken, whent back to reception and they gave me a room on the 15th floor right away very good service. Pool area was open day and night plenty of sun beds available. The room was in the main hotel and is good value. The one thing to add into your cost is the $8.70 dollars per night resort fee. The Dan Marino cafe has some good specials especially the 0.25 cent buffalo wing after midnight, but be warned there is all way a queue. Only 1 poker table at hooters and is no limit but is normally full at night and is a good place to play. The Bellagio hotel and fountain is about 20 minute walk but you can all ways get the monorail at the MGM hotel across the road. The Deuce bus that runs 24 hours a day is $5 dollar one-way or $7 dollars for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “I love staying at hooters but this time someone tried to get into my room.”
Reviews.Author: JEWLS96
Reviews.Content: I had stay at hooters in the past, but this last time was a horrible experience,my room had a connecting door to another room.Around about 11:PM someone tried to open the door from the other room. Here one tip when renting a room like that inform your guest that if they disturb another guest they could get in trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hooters yet”
Reviews.Author: sch00lbusdriver
Reviews.Content: My second stay at Hooters, I would definately stay again. Wonderful location that is within walking distance from the attractions on the strip. Even my wife enjoyed her stay here.

Reviews.Title: “rugby 7's was amazing”
Reviews.Author: NickyClark
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect spot for the weekend we were there. They did a great job incorporating the Rugby 7's tournament into the weekend. I would stay here again if they sponsor the tournament next year... for sure.. cause it was cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Clean,fun hotel,good value.”
Reviews.Author: kiwisteve57
Reviews.Content: From easy check in onwards this was a great place to stay for the Rugby 7s. Smaller casino is OK with us and is a very short walk to the strip. We stayed on the 16th floor overlooking the pools-room was clean and comfortable-not new but that is to be expected.Housekeeping were in and out in the short time we went to breakfast. Buses to the USA 7's events were there a a very regular basis-never waited more that about 15 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Far too expensive for a cheap hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stefers3000
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel i stayed at, in las vegas. Tacky, cheap looking and feeling room. Not at all worth the money i spent to stay here. Not at all. I was supposed to recie.e free slot play, and i didn't. Horrible expirence.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good deal...”
Reviews.Author: lheyman
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came to Vegas for the 7s tournament. We booked with Hooters because they had a package and was $109 compared to $170 at other hotels. During our stay we had stuff stolen from our room, which didn't seem to phase them in the slightest - there was barely any help from there end at all. When it came to check out it cost me $160 to stay in a room for $109, and they couldn't even explain the charges. Never stay here if you want a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kbeza31979
Reviews.Content: Hooters Casino was an inexpensive way to enjoy Las Vegas. The money we didn't spend here was spent well in other places. If you're not looking for a fancy place, but a clean one, then definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, I cant complain!!!”
Reviews.Author: imahotmommy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a pretty, update hotel this is not for you. How ever if you are looking for a place to sleep it off for a while this is perfect. The hotel is close to the strip and a great deal for the money. It is right across from the MGM, the MGM has a monorail stop. The restraunt there is WONDERFUL for the price. We liked it so much we decide to go back the next night for our Anni. dinner. $9.99 prime rib 24/7. after Midnight they serve wings for $0.25 each. yummy had them both nights ALL IN ALL GREAT FOR THE PRICE..... COule be nicer, but then theyd charge more. :)

Reviews.Title: “Hooters Casino Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scout_eighty
Reviews.Content: Great place, Didn't have a reservation. Weekday price was very reasonable. Not on the strip, but the strip does nothing for me anyway. Nice clean rooms, A/C was super frigid and kept the room super cool. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel for the cost”
Reviews.Author: atocdj
Reviews.Content: The plumbing is really the only issue with this casino. The staff is great, and the beds are AWESOME. The plimbing is the old San Remo, so the shower heads are lower, the pressure could be better, and the hot water ran out. The toilet sounded like it was on its last leg. For the price, you can't pick a better hotel on this close to strip. One thing...stay away from the elevator in the parking garage. It is like a death trap waiting to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed - has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: vegasman2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Presidential Suite for 3 nights, what a joke. Should be called the run down shanty. 3 entrances to the suite, only one of them worked the other two were broke. Maid service was sub-par. Pool table was disgusting. Paid 500 a night, biggest rip-off in Vegas. ANY other room you pay 500 a night for in Vegas will be better. Seemed all of the staff were indifferent and could care less if you stayed there (or ate there). I had stayed here when it was the San Remo and since it changed to Hooters but they have let the place go downhill to a point that I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the $”
Reviews.Author: neverrun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights...17th floor...not one complaint! Heated pool and hot tub were a bonus! 25 cent wings and $10 for 5 beer after midnight was a bonus bonus!! Not fancy but clean and on the good end of the strip...extreme value!

Reviews.Title: “Shower goes scaulding to freezing or reverse in 2 seconds when neighbors flush toilet, need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: cptdrm
Reviews.Content: Bed were comfortable and lots of room but.... 1st morning, shower went hot cold hot cold, like as if a 4 yrs old was playing with faucets and toilet. 2nd morning all cold water at 6:45am?? Elevator in parking structure has massive cracks in the wall which make you think the wall is about to crack open. Ordered drinks while at machines 3 times and never got one no matter how long I sat there. Internet access in room not wireless, its on a 4 inch long cable that is on a desk that you cant see tv from. Internet access went up and down 7 times. Breakfast buffet was $12.95, food undercooked, only about 8 items (potato salad, barely boiled crab legs,and fried chicken for breakfast??) and had to wait behind 12 employees who all got in line and invited other employees to cut in line. ACK!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: aztolv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hooters because of last minute changes and the promotion that was being offered. First night we ate at the Hooters Resturant and was not pleased with the wings at all. No sauce! Plain, dried piece of chicken. As for the room, it was ok. The bathroom door was broken,shower head has build up, carpet was coming off the walls, there were some stains on the floor and the bed spread is horrible! Literally it feels like you are sleeping with two thin sheets. We did call for additional blankets which took 2 hours to deliver. Overall, it was ok for price and location. If you come to vegas on a budget or just a place to catch a few hours of sleep and within walking distance to the strip, then Hooters is for you. If you are looking to spend a romantic weekend etc, stay else where!

Reviews.Title: “Got stranded, price was right”
Reviews.Author: KKinCali
Reviews.Content: We got stranded in Vegas due to some bad weather, and when we called our friend to help us with hotel reservations, he told us that Hooters was $20/night. That sounded great. When we arrived, they offered us a "bay" room - which basically translates to a room with a pretty decent bed, light wood furniture, pastel colors and big fake plants with a balcony overlooking the pool. Maybe it was because we were so exhausted but I slept great both nights we were there. Otherwise, the room was pretty gross. I did not want to walk around barefoot. You could see the dust and crud that had built up along the baseboards that no one had bothered to clean. The vanity and the tub needed new caulk, and the tub drain was incredibly slow. The most disgusting part was when it finally drained, it managed to push crud and hair back up INTO the tub. We mentioned this to the front desk, and they did nothing to fix it - although we did get a meal comped when we checked out. We tried the room service for breakfast and it was actually pretty good - huge portions, quick service. Pushed this up to two stars instead of one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: kpitagirl
Reviews.Content: Never again will I stay at this Hotel...The term "you get what you pay for" completely applies to this hotel/casino. Our room was never made up for us, and when I asked the maid for more shampoo and towels she seemed offended. Of course, I still had to pay the daily "resort" fee that covers things like water bottles, towels, and shampoo in the room. Getting a drink while gambling was almost impossible, the "hooters girls" were no where to be found and the hooters wings?....all I can say is don't waste your money. The wings that were served at the "Mad Onion" were even worse, no wonder they only cost 25 cents per wing after midnight. My experience at this hotel and casino was horrible but compared to what my friends experienced while staying there I had it good. We all tried to find someone in charge to complain to but staff at the front desk was not very helpful in this dept either.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: onebigbad1
Reviews.Content: stayed on our way to AZ so wanted something reasonably priced since we are retired, stayed at this property years ago when it was the San Remo so knew it was an older hotel room was good, beds were great, Mad Onion was great breakfast buffet, and prime rib dinner and drinks and app's in bar. We had a pleasurable experience for the price probably wouldn't pay more than $40 to stay since drink prices are pretty high. Would recommend for the right price. Our daughter has stayed several times for girls weekend and had recommended it if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly decent...”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: A colleague found a great deal for a room here and I was skeptical at first, but was pretty pleasantly surprised. For a very cheap rate of $29 a night we had a very clean and adequate room just right off of the strip. I visit Vegas a few times a year, and usually stay at another property. While I probably wouldn't choose to stay here if I was here on vacation, this was a great value to just spent a night if you are here for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “For the price it was very good.”
Reviews.Author: wrweberjr
Reviews.Content: For 20 bucks a night it was a good place to stay. This is not a 3 or 4 or 5 star hotel it might not even be a 2 star hotel, but for the money you can't find much better.

Reviews.Title: “Normally, I enjoy the Hooters concept...”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Karen_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: But delightfully tacky really doesn't translate well intto a lodging concept. The place really has the feel of a Motel 6 as far as decor goes and the rooms are showing wear. I checked in and found 3 inches of water and sand in the sink and assumed they were trying to push some beach feel till I discovered the sink was just clogged (and where the sand came from?). Maintenance spent twenty minutes fixing it but when I returned to the room later and turned in I was greeted w a knock and maintenance insisting I would have to move to another room; I did move after insisting on a comp for the problem ($25 food and beverage credit). Imagine my surprise the next AM when I found my new sink clogged and finsished my shower with three inches of standing water! The best thing was the food; the 'Mad Onion' served a great steak and eggs. Also, try the gaming elsewhere; anyplace paying 6-5 odds for a blackjack is ripping off the players.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are nice, staff is rude!”
Reviews.Author: TheLowDown101
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the Hooters Hotel. When we arrived there was some trash left in the room and the cleaning ladies walked in on my room several times and they took are do not disturb sign so we couldnt put that up. I called the house keeping dpt. and they refused to bring an extra ice bucket to the room. Don't have much for a business center either but pool looked nice although I did not go in it. I mean it wasn't as bad as it sounds. You basically get what you pay for. If you don't have much money to spend and you want a decent location Hooters Hotel it is....Can't beat the rates!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Hooters filthy”
Reviews.Author: Tokeca
Reviews.Content: The price is cheap and you get what you pay for. Room was filthy stains on rug. rugs in hallway filthy. Staff not very nice or helpful. We would not stay there again and suggest that nobody else stay there. Very bland rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good size, good location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: BNotes
Reviews.Content: We love its size, location and price. Some people may consider its size (small) and location (off the strip) its downfalls. The staff was not always aware of hotel policies and consequently we would get conflicting advice.

Reviews.Title: “better comps needed”
Reviews.Author: dede1970
Reviews.Content: i think your comps should be better,i won some money and asked for a comp room and they said no. the next night after giving back alot of my winnings i asked for a comp meal and was told i had 7.43 on my card. i then went to treasure island and didn't even spend half as much and got 2 free buffets, a free room and 50.00 free more play. much better comps at treasure island.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: cstmcvrs
Reviews.Content: It's your average hotel. The room had a good view of the airport which was nice to watch the airlines take off. Looked around the room and found that housekeeping does not go through the room cleaning like they should, found an old coffee cup that someone used for an ash tray on the floor in the corner of the room. They offer a "Buffett Breakfeast" which is more like a "Continental Breakfeast"

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a "guys weekend"”
Reviews.Author: yeti2001
Reviews.Content: If you just want to get away with friends and do not need to stay in a really nice hotel, Hooters is for you. Every year we have a "Guys Weekend" in Vegas and Hooters it the hotel we stay at. It is a really good location (across from MGM) and a short walk to NY/NY. Hooters is the just the right price to save us money to spend on other things. Right Price... But do not expect much.

Reviews.Title: “I should've gotten paid for working instead paying to stay”
Reviews.Author: Foilee
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in 2 years at Hooters for the Shot Show. I had 3 rooms booked for 7 days. There were 2 of us in my particular room. I had to call everyday for towels. Once day when returning around 6 pm our room had yet to be cleaned. When I called about it, we returned to find that they only brought new towels and didn't clean or pick up the dirty towels. Also, one day when we returned there was a latex glove at the foot of one of the beds. I left several messages and spoke to staff about drain in shower being clogged. This was never resolved. Building was always hot and stuffy. We had laundry done one day only to have all information on the box written down wrong and then when the box was found the bell man opened the box and proceeded to go through (clean mind you) to make sure it belonged to us. Our stay 2 years ago was fine...this stay was unacceptable. We will be returning to Vegas for the Shot Show for the next 3 years, but will not return to Hooters. I just don't want anyone to have the same experience we had.

Reviews.Title: “the price is right”
Reviews.Author: enigma300
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel cuz the price is very reasonable. If you're looking for a hotel with fancy 'fixins" - then this is not the hotel for you. The room is basically no thrills type room. They "blanket" is basically a cheap comforter. I'd suggest bring your own blanket with you if you want a good night sleep. Again- this is a great deal for 29 bucks a night- you can spend more money at other hotels but you're paying more for the room.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertisement”
Reviews.Author: keep_it_real2010
Reviews.Content: If there is one thing customers hate about purchasing something it is "false advertisement." When I called Hooters to get there lowest rate, I am told it is $29.99 not included tax so of course you will assume the total would be about $38. Well, when you sign the paperwork as you check in, they underline this price ($8.60) and says it will be charged after check out for each day. They say it is for using the phone for local calls and 800 numbers, it is also for the gym and pool, and is not optional.Also the parking is suppose to be included in the price as well so, why ask if the parking was free on this current survey if it wasn't? I was staying there for only one night to sleep and drop off a friend to the airport. We did not have any gym or swimwear with us and was not planning on using none of the "not optional" facilities, but I still have to pay....never understood why if the $8.60 not optional that Hooters would just say the room is $38.60 plus tax instead of making seem like they have the lowest rate in town. Most people come to gamble and sleep in the room ONLY not come to Hooters to workout.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and view =D”
Reviews.Author: gettome28
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel last week and I can't say enough about it. The price was great and staff were very friendly. It does have a small casino but for me, I wanted to explore the city so it was just right. I liked the resturant being open 24 hrs a day and the store being open more than the typical 8-5 hours. The room I had looked out over the strip and was beautiful at night with the curtain and window open. Bathroom was really good size and service each day was good from cleaning staff. The walk to the strip was a short one as long as you have comfortable shoes. It could be a little unnerving at night when you are the only one but never did I feel unsafe. Didn't hear any noise from the strip and very close to the airport. Five minute ride by shuttle. Bed was a king bed and I wanted to take it with me, very comfortable especially after a day of walking and exploring.

Reviews.Title: “was made happy”
Reviews.Author: voncar
Reviews.Content: when we first arrived we were very dissapointed, the casino was very hot and smoky, we got to our room and it was filty, it had hair in the bed, the toilet looked like it had pee on it, the lamp shades were all bent and crooked the room looked as if it was used, then we were moved to another room that at least had been wiped down but in my opinion both room were dirty, I do realize that its a cheaper hotel for the lower end rooms but there is no reason why they have to be dirty... vacume the corners and clean the corners on the tile there was mold. which i find unexceptable. I understand that alot of people stay in them but the maid service needs a lesson on how to clean, I know I do this for a living.. we did get upgraded to a suite which was not bad, it was cleaner just expensive..

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun34
Reviews.Content: Hooters Hotel is located just off the Las Vegas Strip behind the Tropicana. The location was manageable and within walking distance if you bring comfortable shoes. The Hotel desk staff and restaurant staff were nice and accomodating. The room we were given was horrible. The bed I slept in was broken and the sheets did not even cover the entire bed as a flat sheet was used vs. a fitted sheet. There was no microwave or refrigerator. When we told the front desk, we were then given another room on another floor. That room had a sleepable bed, but I did not want to touch the shower head and there was no way I'd take a bath with mold in the corners of the tub. The rooms, however, did come with 2 bottles of water, shampoo and lotion, and some coupons for discounted buffet at the restaurant. In all, it was cheap, but I would have rather stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad deal but needs inprovement”
Reviews.Author: rzuff
Reviews.Content: Hotel and room were decent. The main issue was the awful smell on the 7th floor when you got off the elevator. It looks like they were replacing carpet. Additionally they were working at early morning hours which woke me a up a couple times. We called for extra towels and were told guest services was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Quality Rooms and Bad Promos”
Reviews.Author: InkDog
Reviews.Content: Old Rundown Hotel. Ran out of Hot Water. $100 free slots promotion is a scam. You have to turn your $100 into $8500 dollars before you can cash out, then they only give you $50 for every $8500 you've earned. You have to play on their $10 per hand slots. Practically imposible unless you hit the big jackpot within the first 10 tries.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, but might pay more next time”
Reviews.Author: punkin0916
Reviews.Content: Can't beat a $22 a night room rate. The casino was nice and small and we didn't have to walk far at all to the tables, or the elevator or the restaurant. I was disappointed that the "crib" for our infant, was actually a pack-n-play, as other Vegas hotels we've stayed at have cribs on wheels with a nice mattress for the baby. The actual Hooters restaurant wasn't anything special. We walked over to the MGM, which was nice and quick. Wished we would've eaten at the Rainforest Cafe though for the same price as Hooters. Only 2 tables in the poker room, but the action was great. They have $3 blackjack 24/7 too which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “It's time to UpDate the Bathrooms & Towels!”
Reviews.Author: gamgator2000
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Hooters, however I feel that it's time for Hooters to invest in some UpGrades! The Showers are "Outdated" and all the Towels in my room were "Frayed". The guest rooms (14th floor Tower) were nice, but the "Bathrooms" were an "EyeSore". Also, the "Staff" was very nice! Glenn in DV, CA

Reviews.Title: “I Love Hooters Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KarlGM
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a convention. Everyone stayed across the street paying 75 to 150 per night. Me $25. Great room, intresting decor. It's not the Hilton but it's great dor the price.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: tankgirl86
Reviews.Content: As my title states it's better to just stay away from this hotel. First their "upgraded room" is just to a room on a higher level. The pool is small and gross, it looks absolutely nothing like what is pictured here. Our first room was filthy, the carpet was so disgusting you would never walk on it with bare feet, the bathtub had green mold growing out of the cracks, and the shower head was caked on with mold and mildew. It was so nasty we went to the front desk to complain. All they would do was move us to a different room which turned out to be just as nasty as the first one. The sheets were stained, the window (supposedly with a view) was so dirty you can't see out, there were stains on the headboard, no sheet on the mattress, and the bathroom floor was disgusting. To top it all off we thought we weren't even going to make it to the room with the way the parking structure elevator was. It felt like it was going to drop any second. We did eat at the Mad Onion restaurant inside which has nice people and good food but it is also disgusting, the booth seats are full of old food crumbs, we didn't even stay we got our food to go. Oh and don't bother trying to call Hotels.com for any advice they do not stand behind their hotels and are extremely rude, they will NOT do anything about your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Eww, eww, eww!”
Reviews.Author: jengo97
Reviews.Content: Nasty, gross, unclean, smelly, discusting. Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Damn good time, hooters is the shiznitobam!”
Reviews.Author: FUNtroubleFUN
Reviews.Content: Room stayed clean, bed got made.... service, was good. The only way it could have been better was if hooters girls came with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price (read if worried about other reviews)!”
Reviews.Author: 900king
Reviews.Content: I (29) was iffy on staying here with my wife (28) after reading some of the reviews from this site and others. I decided to stick it out with the $39/night rate and hope for the best. The hotel was much better than expected. Like others have mentioned, they sell out of the bungalow rooms fast so you'll be offered a free "upgrade" upon check in. I would imagine all the rooms are the same except for the presidential and international suites. The rooms in the towers are attached to the casino/lobby. The bungalow rooms surround the pool but are not connected to the casino. The pool area looked clean and professional. We did not test the water but I have no reason to believe it was anything less than acceptable. The staff was friendly at check-in (~15 min) and throughout our stay. The hooters restaurant was one of the best I've been to recently. The waitresses did not have bad attitudes or seem unhappy like some hooters around the country. Dan Marino's is a little weak as far as upscale dining. We chose to eat at Smith and Wolensky, The Palm, Spago for fine dining. We ordered room service one morning. The service was quick and the food was hot. Probably a better deal than Marino's breakfast buffett too. The room was clean, bed was nice, bathroom was acceptable, hallways and elevator areas were clean and well lit. I did not see any reason to complain especially for the price. The casino has a generous amount of slots and other computer games. The table games are sparce. 2 roulette tables, 4 bj, 2 craps, and a couple different poker tables. They do offer a daily poker tournament with reasonable buy in. I did not feel uncomfortable with the patrons in the casino. Plenty of security presence. The location is ok if you don't mind walking or taking cabs. It's approx. $10 to cab to mid strip (ceasar's, ph, paris, etc...) Walking to the strip depends on your pace but a brisk pace put us in front of MGM on the strip in approx 10 minutes. We did not check out the enterainment or nightlife at hooter's but you can receive free tickets to the magic show by signing up for the owl club rewards card. This was my 3rd trip to vegas in '09. I probably will not stay here again due to location. We enjoy being on the strip moreso than off. If you are looking for a clean, safe, cheap room close to the strip this is your place. If you spend most of your time on the strip either in the casino's or at nightclubs, this might not be the best place unless you are willilng to pay cab fares.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Another Hotel But Do Go See The Show”
Reviews.Author: arrick
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of value, but next time we will pay more and stay at a nicer hotel located midway on the strip. Our room was old and dirty - the safe was broken, the bedspread had all of the batting wadded up in the foot, the bathroom grouting was stained and mildewed, the walls had chunks of sheetrock missing. Overall, very disappointing. The casino is small but nice. We spent the majority of our gambling money in the hotel because of the Owl Rewards Club card the hotel offers. At the end of our stay, though, our points only bought us a $19 meal. The Onion Restaurant was a nice, affordable place to eat - our waitress was upbeat and friendly, and the food was not bad. Be warned, however, that starting at midnight, they have a 25 cent wing special, so the line winds through the casino - it can be a long wait. The hotel features Purple Reign - it is a Prince tribute band and well worth the $25 each ticket price. The singer was spot on, and we had a great time at this show. Also, keep in mind that this hotel is kind of far down on the south side of the strip, so you will have to either walk a lot, or pay for a cab or monorail ticket to get to a lot of the other attractions/hotels further down. We took a cab to Freemont street and with tip, it was $60 round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas is going down-hill FAST! Will NOT Stay Here Again Either!!”
Reviews.Author: JDofCA
Reviews.Content: This was suppose to be a 'romantic' time for us - BLAH what a disaster!! The room - a "non-smoking" - smelled HORRIBLY of smoke (& my spouse has allergy issues). The bathroom was covered in dead ants and a VERY strong of bug spray - it made the stay worse!! There was no carpeting in some spots in the room, the walls had holes as did the bathroom door. The electric on the clock and TV kept coming off and on. I do not believe that the main room door was actually a fire-safety door either! The people working there lack basic customer service skills! The room I/we had was suppose to be an "upgrade" - I/we felt like the Motel 6 across the way would have been an upgrade! SAD VERY SAD!!!! We stayed additional time but I only booked one night "just in case" - and I am GLAD I only booked one night... AWEFULL! What is happening to Vegas?? We tried here because others on the Strip have been lacking lately ... looks like ALL are the same any more =( TOO BAD TOO BAD

Reviews.Title: “You absolutely get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: juststartedtraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hooters, having gotten a great deal on vegas.com (two nights for the price of one..$60 for both nights). The beds are comfortable, the room is clean enough but not spotless. The hallways directly outside of the rooms are definitely dirty. I noticed some broken outlets and VERY rusted door hingers on the bathroom door (see pics). Some rust in the tub and lots of buildup on the shower head. The view out to the Strip properties would have been fine but the windows were extremely dirty. The AC/Heating unit are extremely old and noisy. The casino and amenities are subpar. Didn't use the pool...too cold. Valet is extremely slow; there seems to be only one valet on duty at any given time. The walk to the Strip is about 10 minutes. Stay here if you're on a budget or simply need a place to sleep/take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love Hooters!”
Reviews.Author: travelmore12
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a batchelor party and we had a group of three rooms. Rooms are very large and comfortable. I was surprised in the tower rooms there was even a balcony. Staff is really friendly and we had no problems during our stay. I definately recommend this hotel for a guys weekend in Vegas! The pool and hot tub was open in december too!

Reviews.Title: “i Loved my stayed”
Reviews.Author: padillagabbys
Reviews.Content: We had a great time... even dough that we didn't win.... :) but we are looking foward to visit Vegas again this summer! i hope to see u guys then... and thank you for everything...

Reviews.Title: “Great rated best beds”
Reviews.Author: rwilliam11
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Hooters it is around the corner from our grandkids. The bungalow part is perfect for us. We park in the Handicap slot walk right into our room no elevators. Hooters has to have the best beds in Las Vegas I always get a great night of sleep. wish I could take it home with me.

Reviews.Title: “I like Hooters”
Reviews.Author: snoopolio
Reviews.Content: Hooters makes me feel like Im at an exotic resort. I really like the atmosphere established throughout the casino and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: RadDudeLa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price! One of the first times I didn't feel ripped off from the price of a hotel, and felt I got more than my money's worth instead of less. We only paid $22 a night! It's only 1 block from the best part of the strip. 3 pools(2 heated) and 2 jacuzzis OPEN 24 hrs. year round!! That was my favorite part. A fun, young, party atmosphere and at the same time a professional staff. The rooms were clean, nice, and roomy and the hotel had everything I needed, including a nice workout room. Cute, friendly hooters girls walking around! I would definitely stay there again. If you want to stay at a big, decent hotel that's close to all the best stuff and not spend a lot of money, this is the place. My wife loved it even more than me.

Reviews.Title: “I have really low hotel/motel standards, but this was a nightmare :(”
Reviews.Author: NotUsuallyTooPicky
Reviews.Content: We checked in after driving in from a day in LA. Yay! Hooters! So far so good. Upon entering the room, I found dead cockroach on the counter. OK, I lived in Florida, I can deal with that. As I walked farther into the room, I realized that the floor was squishy....and I was standing in a puddle. The floor in between the bed and bathroom wall was soaked. The sliding glass "door" that overlooked the roof of the casino was broken and permanently stuck about an inch open. But the icing on the cake was that when whoever was in the room above us turned on their water, it sounded like a waterfall inside the wall (I can only assume this is where the puddle came from). I called the front desk to report my findings and I was told there were no other rooms available, but they would send up a maintenance guy. He took almost an hour to get there, didn't actually fix anything. I called again and they informed me that no other rooms were available. After the worst night's sleep I've ever had in a hotel we checked out, and when I asked about any possible comps for our numerous inconveniences, I was told I should have just been switched to another room--there were PLENTY of vacancies last night! In the end, we were given a meal voucher for the cost of our room, and after several free beers and many tasty, tasty Hooters wings, I left only angry enough to take almost 2 years to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms farily cheap, but $100 slot play is scam.”
Reviews.Author: Ialsotookatrip
Reviews.Content: Rooms are fairly cheap, but that is what you expect in Vegas, so you will play at their casino... But the advertised "Free $100 slot play" is a scam... I am old enough to know better (like nothing is free & never trust a politician)... But with several places similar in cost and amenities, I made decision to stay at Hooters because of free Slot play... What they don't tell you: 1. You must register (for some kind of club which is free) 2. The line to register took at least 30 minutes 3. Can only play at specific slots in a specific, roped-off area and you can not change slot machines. 4. You can not cash in any of the winnings except: A. If you max out the machine, they would give you $35 or $70 (confusing and unclear)... B. You could keep $1,000 jackpot if won... Would like to know how many jackpots have been won all year... Room was OK and Bungalow rooms were convenient to parking if you don't like having to negotiate elevators and tall towers, but I have seen more modern plumbing in 3rd world countries... Funny thing... they ask guests to reuse towels to be "green", so they don't waste water in the desert... but plumbing was so bad, I estimate that 80% of the water never made it to the shower and went straight down the drain... Also, smokers had smoked in no-smoking room (butts were still in cup outside garden door)... My 2 cents and no I did not put 1 cent in the casino at Hooters... Not even the "free" money...

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: theoldbuzzard77
Reviews.Content: $25.00 a night wow!!! Great Value, Great Location for 25 how could you compain but lots do.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding place to stay, not to crowded.”
Reviews.Author: hoopbegay
Reviews.Content: Nice, comfortable place to stay. The hotel is not too crowded. Have shuttles running to every event.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey”
Reviews.Author: brighteyesinpa
Reviews.Content: It was a lot smaller than I expected and getting through the casino to our room was a nightmare through the clouds of smokers. I had requested a king room, but was given a double bed room and requested that we move the next day. I asked for a non-smoking room, but after waiting over 8 hours, took what was given and it was a smoking room. There was a daily "resort" fee charged and when I asked what it included, I was told use of the swimming pool (it was an average of 40 degrees!) and the gym. In spite of looking for the gym, I was unable to find it. The valet parking service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Slow or No responce from room maintence, Hassled by security”
Reviews.Author: philipe
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hooters after checking into my room, I went to take some pictures of the beautiful pool area and was trailed by a security guard. And then went to my room and he was peeking through the glass door into my room that goes out to the pool. So I invited him in, There he asked, are you a guest here!!! I said yes do you see my luggage!!.Then he asked How come you took so many pictures? I then ran through the pluged sink and tub drain also the broken lock on sliding glass door out to pool.The room was totally unsecured. He called house maintence then nobody showed up!! Then I called house maintence they told nobody is working today and have not heard the request??Somebody showed up the next day to finally fix the lock on the door! I had to go find a plunger and try to unclog the sink and tub myself!!! You are on your own if you stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth it ! Don't even bother visiting that place !”
Reviews.Author: MrPackYourBags
Reviews.Content: Talking about unsophisticated staff and guests, that's Hooters Las Vegas for sure ! Asked for early check-in days before, didn't get it (right Sarah ?). Made a reservation of a non-smoking room, got a smoking one (right Sarah ?). Drunk guests in the elevators at nights ? Pretty common. Oh, and the service elevator of my apartment building is much nicer than that. Vomit on the corridor carpet outside my room ? Yes, once. Pretty sizeable bugs in the bathroom ? Yes, twice. Unfriendly, low-aged unprepared staff ? Yes. And talking about those Hooters girls at the casino, come on, I find much much friendlier girls at the Hooters restaurants up here in Brazil. Let's see if I forgot something... Oh, yes, I checked-out early in the morning and when I asked to deduct the players' card balance from my bill, surprise ! The person in charge of that (whoever that is) was absent. The front desk couldn't do it ! Since I could not wait for Mr. Balance to show up, because I had to rush to the airport, I ended up with an orange piece of plastic *** with dozens of dollars in it. Come on, it just takes a walk down the Strip to realize how far in the past in terms of architecture and service Hooters Casino & Hotel is. They should sell that place to some business group who knows how to run a casino-hotel. Just tour inside Wynn, the Bellagio, Paris and you will know what I mean. Do NOT fall for those cheap rates ! Usually, what you will get is cheap service. It pays to have comfort and to be away from bad service and those college kids on Vegas for a weekend to paaaaaaaartyyyyyy... Humpf. If I could find one positive aspect of my staying, I would say the room view to the Strip (MGM, NYNY...), but I'm sure those mega Strip hotels exceed that easily.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel Not Worth The Savings”
Reviews.Author: mkluber87
Reviews.Content: I needed a last minute additional night stay and was looking near the air port for a first flight out in the morning. My agent found Hooters at $54 per night and right next to airport, perfect right? The check in process took over 45 minutes and in the process kept my credit card. The front desk staff did not care about the check in wait and the attitude was "too bad". Upon looking for my credit card, the front desk said that I needed to go to the security desk which became a circus because the security desk had no idea. Only when I emphatically told the security desk (a raised platform lording over the casino like a housing authority project) did they bother to look. I ended up not getting my card and just cancelled it. Oh - and the wake up call I asked for never came. Bad morale, the staff is just waiting to get laid off.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this hole”
Reviews.Author: ROISHA4373
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the worst experiences EVER that I've had in Vegas. I've stayed at Treasure Island, Excalibur, Ballys, etc. I can appreciate a great bargain and understand "you pay for what you get so don't expect more mentality"....HOWEVER this place was not cheap!!! Where do I began? Asked for an extra pillow - the two that were on the bed were like pancakes and 25 yrs old. They promptly told me "we ran out of pillows and would bring extras up to my room as soon as they get more". 24 hrs later, I asked the front desk and they miraculously found 2 extra pillows. I booked 2 double beds. Not until I hiked up to the 12th floor did I find out that I was given 1 King bed. When I went down to ask for it to be corrected, there was no apology but made me feel like I made the mistake. Their website stated 100 free tokens but I had to get up to my 12th floor to discover they forgot to give them to me. Vending machine was dripping of water and had been for 2 days straight. It also ate my $2.00! Regarding the housekeeping......awful! i purposely left tissues on the floor to see if they'd pick them up and guess what??? No, they left them right there! No wireless internet capability - only some 1950;s device that needs an ethernet cable to be plugged into it! REALLY? Don't waste your money, look around more - I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem.”
Reviews.Author: Peinado
Reviews.Content: Although we had plumbing issues, the staff responded quickly! Rooms were roomy, clean and the overall hotel/casino was very pleasant. Great prices for 1/2 block off Vegasstrip.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort at an even better value!”
Reviews.Author: fish1002
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hooters casino many times. They have great room rates and are right across the street from the MGM. Their casino is small and intimate and their pool is open 24hours. Plus the Mad Onion restaurant has 25 cent wings after midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Secret”
Reviews.Author: Casinobabe
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to Hooters. The staff is freindly and helpful, beds and pillows are comfortable. They have cable television and complimentary bottles of water in the rooms. Dan Marinos has the 9.95 prime rib 24 hrs and the Hooters hot wings are great. The price is right .

Reviews.Title: “Great views and Excellent Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Rubisunset
Reviews.Content: My wife really liked the prime rib special. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the fresh fruit and with biscuits. The housekeeping service was very good and thoughtful, she brought my daughter extra sheets w/o asking for them on the second night. Hooters restaurant waitress were friendly and helpful. Although menu was different: prices and sauce choices were minimum. Food was very good and beer too. Dixie bar did not have the great looking ladies that were pictured, only couple of bartender guys. Maybe seasonal? Casino girls were nice and nice looking. Machines need updating like the MGM across the street. The room AC was VERY old and HARD to maintain a consistant temperature makeing sleeping difficult at times. It is VERY LOUD and either Very HOT or COLD no in between. Although, we did not win the $$$, we will likely return if price is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with a good location”
Reviews.Author: eclimber
Reviews.Content: The room itself could use some attention in that there was peeling paint and a slightly damaged drain in the bathroom. The hallways were rather dingy and did not feel very welcoming. The casino itself was good. Sure, not as upscale as many of the other casinos but the service was excellent and the staff were very helpful and welcoming. The gem of the hotel/casino was the gym, though I couldn't figure out how to turn on all the lights.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jayman520
Reviews.Content: I was suckered in by the Internet special. The casino itself is small but relatively clean, the rooms however were dirty and dated. I do not reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price .... I have not one complaint!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy74
Reviews.Content: My family and I always stay at hooters ! They are always accomodating our every need ! In this day n age , with the economics the way they are u just can't beat the prices of the rooms at hooters!!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: kickdiva1
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a total dump based on the price we paid, but were pleasantly surpirsed. It is a small casino with a lot of penny and nickle slots. There was a restraunt, club, and show on site. The food was pretty good, so were the drinks (just don't buy a drink, they are very expensive considering you can sit at a machine and get them for free. The gym had pretty good equipment for such a small hotel. The pool area was cozy with fire pits and different seating areas for visiting. The rooms were typical of a Howard Johnson or equivalent. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. However, there were food trays sitting outside someones door by the eleveator for 2 days which was anoying. We were in walking distance to many of the bigger hotels which was nice. All in all I would stay here again if I didn't want to spend the money at a bigger hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jbkiel
Reviews.Content: Very good location to stay at south strip. One of Vegas smaller hotels, which I prefer. It doesn´t take long time to get access to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Mates”
Reviews.Author: johnc3720
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights on a trip with mates from the UK. Overall this is a smaller and more friendly hotel which means it doesn't take 30 minutes to get back to your room if you forget your camera. Yes it is not as plush as other hotels, yes the fascilities are not as up to date but if you need a hotel as a place to crash with mates then this is the place. The staff were all really friendly and helpful, there was a party going on all day, the pool and bars were excellent, and last but the not least the hooters bar is top class. Other reviews say this is off strip, it is but only 100 yards off strip! It is located next to the MGM and in a real good spot for getting about Vegas. Would I go back, hell yeah, would I go with my Wife, Hell NO, butu saying that her and her friends are staying there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Quick, easy and the stay was clean”
Reviews.Author: Kwiedemann
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying at the hotel The service and food was pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Seemed like best price, but.......”
Reviews.Author: WillB_AZ
Reviews.Content: I searched the web for a good price on a single night stay in Las Vegas. Hooters was offering a low price and what seemed to be a good location. So I booked the room. When we got there I learned that there was an extra "cleaning" charge of $12 per night. This increased the cost of the room by nearly 20%. The drinks were very expensive, $7 for a cocktail, $14 for a double shot of name-brand rum. Internet service is $13 a day. The hotel is located across the street from the MGM but you have to walk down the street a 1/4 mile to cross over on a pedestrian bridge. Then you have to walk the entire length of the MGM to get to the Monorail. The funny thing is I could see the monorail station straight across from Hooters! Finally, the rooms were functional but seemed to be converted from another hotel chain. There were no bedside lamps, only floor lamps in the corners. Wood "patches" were applied where the bed lamps used to be attached to the wall. But the room was clean. So beware of the price and be aware that the location is not as good as it seems!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: potroaster
Reviews.Content: Well after reading most of the reviews, I was very hesitant to go. But I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived. Check in did not take that long. The room was clean, beds were good. Staff were nice to deal with. I paid less than 40 bucks a day(fri-tues). Location was awesome. A few cigarette burns here and there, but room was better than I expected. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “WOULDN'T STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: irene010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to vegas and on our drive up we booked the room here at Hooters. We thought it was a good price. However we will never stay here again. To start off the elevators are falling apart. There were cracks in the corners from the top to the bottom, if you push the wall a little you can see through---SCARY!!!! The hall ways to the rooms are so dirty and it smelled. There was no ice in the ice machine the whole time we were there and had to go up 2 floors to get ice. Our shower didn't work right. Half the water came out of the shower head and the other half came from the tub spout. The handle to turn on the water in the shower needed major maintence. Our air/heater was sooo loud that we had to turn it off to sleep. The capet was so dirty and the room smelled funny. However one nite we got in really late,(or you can say early, about 4am) and were hungry, so we ordered room service and I would say our food came fairly quick and it was hot and tasted good. We had decided to extend our stay but did not stay here. We booked another room at another hotel and stayed 2 more days there. This would be a decent hotel if they would keep up with the maintence and do a little more cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good facility, adequate staff.”
Reviews.Author: willTj
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were given keys to an occupied room at the opposite end of the facility. Had to return to the lobby with baggage and baby for another room. We were never offered help with luggage which would have been polite after making us walk so far. Wanted big bed but got 2 standard, it was a pleasant surprise that we could get an infant bed. We liked the room, it was very clean and tasteful, not fancy but good. Beds were adequate. Big letdown was the staff. Most were polite but nowhere near the standard I find at the restaurants which we frequent. when we returned to the desk after being given the wrong room we were helped politely but never felt like we were important. The 2 desk people chatted with a 3rd employee from retail, the desk guy was trying to get a free shirt. The girl in the poolside cofffee shop in the morning was just plain rude.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a B hotel off the main drag”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCliff
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel on the whole. Not as fancy as the MGM across the street, but close enough to the strip to get to things, accessible to the monorail and the prices were good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: JoanneG2
Reviews.Content: this hotel was excellent , ideal location to walk anywere , rooms clean and had everything you needed casino was ideal size not too big but again had evertything you needed pool was gorgeous weather was lovely for november sat by the pool most days everyone in our group enjoyed it and they varied from age 21 to 60 men and women .room had 2 double beds in tv and computer games .

Reviews.Title: “Won't go again!”
Reviews.Author: maybelline79
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline.com. Unfortunately I wasn't expecting to see Hooters as a result. The front desk though it was quick to check in, the service was bad. Also, the hotel charges an additional $5.65 as a reserve fee that is also added onto the price which I wasn't expecting. Therefore, it ended up costing more then what priceline promised. The housekeeping staff charged me for water that I did not drink. I will definitely think twice before booking Hooters. You mind as well pay a few more dollars for a descent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money just round the corner from The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Grecofan
Reviews.Content: Check in and out were slow and the standard of service at the desk neither as efifcient nor as friendly as we experienced in other hotels and motels while in the US, however this hotel was excellent value for money (less than £35 for two nights!). We were supposed to have a Bungalow room but were given an Ocean View one instead - this turned out to be a blessing as it was several floors up away from traffic noise and music piped around the pool area from early morning. The room was large and well-appointed. The only gripe was that the bath took ages to drain of water when having a shower. The breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant was good/varied and fruit plate I had was huge. Prices on a par with the other places we breakfasted during our holiday. The room was quiet, however we think that occupancy levels were pretty low. The other guests of the hotel were predominantly a younger crowd than us - we're in our late 30s.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: azam66
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again, The worse service ever. I would rather stay at Motel 6 where I have recieved better service. I was given a smoking room even though I told them due to me being asmatic I needed a non smoking room. They didn't even make an effort to accomodate me. The view I saw was trash. When the maid came in to make the bed it looked like she just threw the bedspread and pillows. The Dan Marino restaurant had extremely slow service even though it wasn't crowded. I was completely dissapointed. I have written a letter to the hotel manager but have yet to recieve a response.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected from the reviews I read”
Reviews.Author: AmarilloTxCooney
Reviews.Content: Some friends of mine were going to Vegas so I headed out as well at the last possible moment. Was looking for a room on the cheap decided to give Hooters a try glad I did. The rooms are pretty much like a motel 6 room with Hooters trim. My room was fine and very clean house keeping did a great job. The room service was great as well both the restaurants were excellent and thrift priced compared to a block away at the strip. I am a person that likes a luxury room as much as the next guy my wife and I stayed at Bellagio in Sep in a suite for $450 a nite and it was luxury this room averaged $22 and was well worth the price. The $9.95 prime rib was great as well as the steak and eggs For $11.95

Reviews.Title: “Hooters better than I thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: crileyteach
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews on this hotel/casino I was a little unsure, but...the price was right & it was so near the "strip". First, the room was clean, fair sized & comfy! I also had a great view of the strip from my window! The pool was awesome because it is open 24/7! After a big day/night of LV, it was nice to swim or hot tub at any hour! It is nothing fancy at all. Just a nice & clean pool (2 of them) & 2 hot tubs. On site restaurants were fine (nothing special). The casino was nice because it was small & clean. It is right across from MGM so you can just walk across the street to be in a huge casino, night life, studio 54 (fun night club!!) & the tram! the tram will take you up the "strip" Tropicana is right next door & Excalibur across from that. So it is near many fun things to do if you don't have a car. I stayed when the prices were dirt cheap. It was only $35 a night! but I see their prices have gone WAY up! too bad! it is not fancy! Not all that sexy either. The people who work there are real nice & professional as well. the security guards were NOT awesome. They mostly talked to each other & never really seemed to care what was happening around them. I had to ask them a question & they both seemed annoyed I interrupted them! Oh well...

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jillsiehs
Reviews.Content: Not luxury but comfortable economy. Hotel is older and well worn but clean. Don't expect excellent room service. Our hair dryer broke and it took 1+ hrs to get a new one delivered (we left after an hour so I'm not sure how long it took). Hotel atmosphere is fun and laid back. Nice music playing. Room was clean and bed surprisingly comfortable. Walking distance to several other hotels. If you have the time I recommend visiting the VooDoo Lounge (on top of The Rio) in the evening. You get a beautiful view of the city and great music. If you get there early, you might even get free entrance passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price and location, not to great if you have minors.”
Reviews.Author: laj0131
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hooters las vegas from Oct 10 thru the 12th. We went to Vegas for a wedding and decided on this hotel as it was fairly cheaper and close to the strip. its a pretty small hotel not as big as i thought it would be the staff was very nice to you IF you where gambling if you where just walking through the casino they seemed to be very rude and very rude to my son. I have a 13 year old, we where walking to the garage and we where waiting for the rest of our party to catch up, so we stood right in front of the elevators to wait for them, this very rude person comes up (who works for hooters) and rudley asks him ARE YOU OVER 21??? i looked at her and said no he is not and your point! she tells me well this is a gaming area so he is not allowed here, i said ok well we are staying here and going to our car we are by the elevators (which mind you there are no games by) and she was like well he needs to wait in the garage! i looked at her and was like umm yeah i dont think so but thanks for your suggestion LOL! at that point the rest of our party arrived and we left. The gift shop sucks it only has a few items, most of the areas are empty or just have 1 or 2 shirts. OMG and the restaurant ewwww!! i had never eaten at hooters before so we decided to have dinner there our first night to try out the wings. Once again because we had a minor we had to wait longer as they only have one area for you to sit with minors. (all this really means is that the girls dont bend down and have there hooters all over the place LOL!) Once the wait was over we where seated, right by the kitchen area where all the traffic is because everyone is going back and forth to get the food. The girls...i was a little surprised i thought they would all be very pretty with nice bodies and that was not the case. I was sooo dissapointed with the wings they where just oozzing grease and had no flavor whatsoever and these where suppose to be the hot wings. All in all i would never go back to that restaurant..

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price, friendly staff but would prefer to stay elsewhere for a few bucks more”
Reviews.Author: Mambodaughter
Reviews.Content: scored the room for $25 which included a breakfast. all staff we came across was friendly. room was a decent size but really needs to be updated. i would typically say it was amazing bang for my buck but in Vegas perspectives, i cant say such a thing. for about the same price or maybe $10, i couldve stayed at many other options including Excalibur, which i have stayed at before and was much nicer and with a great location. also Sams Town was cheap and better but I avoided due to nonconvenient location for my plans on my trip. overall, not terrible, but i personally would try something else on my next round.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I thought- but definitely worth $24!”
Reviews.Author: kmontgomery01
Reviews.Content: Hotel was okay. I expected it to be a little nicer since it said that it opened in 2006, but I think they just redid an older hotel. Dealers were really nice and taught me how to play craps. Had a lot of fun at that table. The dealers were not the standard "Hooters" type workers though- so that was different than I expected. I only paid $24 per night so it was a great deal in that regard and I would stay there again because it was so inexpensive. If you don't mind staying a tiny bit off the strip it'll work!!!

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: xandercody
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the money. However if I had to do it over again I would spend a little more and get a lot more. the people were really nice. The food in Dan Marino's was horrible. The prime rib had more fat on it then meat. hooters food was normal but of course you paid more for that. No coffee maker in the room and no coffee in the hotel. The room was average but severely lacking in outlets. The rooms were called beach side so I thought I was going to see at least a view of the pool...nope a view of the parking lot. The pool was very nice and the staff including security by the pool were awesome! the hotel very quiet in the room areas so that was really nice sign up for the free chips just to get the coupon to see the comedian for 7.95. I laughed from the beginning to the end!! hilarious

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: nashvillefunk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a quick cheap trip in Aug 2008. We got a dirt cheap bungalo room and it suited our needs just fine. The pool area was a nice place to relax at night, the staff was friendly and more importantly it was like $30/night. If you want something that just works well for quick trips or if you're not planing on spending much time in the room this hotel was perfect. We're staying one day here again in December for nastalgia before moving on to the Bellagio for the remaining 4 nights. Cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters is just for Wings!!”
Reviews.Author: raester13
Reviews.Content: LOOOVE hooters wings but not their hotel...waaat kind of place is this anyways?! we weren't in the room more than to change and sleep but wow was it run down. Moldy showers, Dirty Carpet, DUMB front desk staff, and to top it off as we were packing to leave I discovered ANTS on the bed that had found their way to my suitcase. One reason would be because Room Service didn't clean up food from the hallway ....just GROSS!

Reviews.Title: “A HOOTING TOOTING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: julieBarnsley
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel in 9/9/09 the hotel was nice. the down side was that the towels they provdided around the pool were very small to say the least (best take your own) the room was ok but it would be a lot better with fresh painted walls and a new carpet, the wardbrobe doors didnt work either. the breakfast buffee was ok but we found another hotel that was a lot better ( the next one up) the location was ideal it didnt take you too long to be on the strip about a 5minute walk. all in all the budget hotel gets my vote for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, it was a hoot!”
Reviews.Author: scottishgirl83
Reviews.Content: Although off strip this hotel is in a great location. Check in was fast and easy, our room was standard but clean. Our window looked out on Tropicana and the strip, great views of NYNY and MGM at night. Our safe was faulty, i think the prveious guests left if locked but we called security and they were up in minutes to fix it. Weather was quite cool (even for us Scots) so we didn't spend much time by the pool. We did spend a wee while at the jacuizi next to the pool however. The pool area was clean and towels were available. The casino itself was very small compared to the others and got quite busy on the weekends when it filled up with guys. We ate a few times in Dan marinos which did a good breakfast. The beds were comfy and hotel noise was pretty minimal. Hooters is in walking distance of a lot of the major hotel/casinos so taxi and bus journeys were kept to a minimum. If I return any time soon and hooters is still stnading i will definately consider it.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Rachel1087
Reviews.Content: Was shocked to read other bad reviews for Hooter Las Vegas. We had a great stay and enjoyed our three nights here. We did have to queue for check in and it was through the Pokie Machines in the casino but it was resonably quick and nothing like the queues in the other hotel we had looked in. Great room and decor, very clean and tidy. Very close to The Strip and gas station, convenience store and Coco's Resturant. Also used both Hooters Resturants and brought souvenirs from Hooters shops. Our room over looked the pool, which we didn't use but plenty of people were and we did have drinks by it, very nice. We used the casino and enjoyed the free first drink when using a machine (not serious gamblers - had to say we had 'Been there done that' in Vegas!). I would say this hotel is more suitable for young people in party mode, although saying that we are in our 40's and still enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the young crowd!!”
Reviews.Author: WDWLuvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here and loved the amosphere. it is not the highest paying casino on the strip but great to kick back and relax in. great for people in their 20s and 30s. Pool was cool, several seperated pools and hot tubs, one with a waterfall. didnt go in the hot tub, didnt look as clean as the pool. stayed in thr bungalow rooms off the pool, nice view, basic no frills room, bed was comfy, room was clean, a little outdated, but for our purposes it was great for $40 a night!!

Reviews.Title: “HOOTERIFIC!”
Reviews.Author: lvsftballchk10
Reviews.Content: Came out with some friends for a softball tournament, had a blast at the pool party and the specials around the casino! Thanks for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: helrayzor
Reviews.Content: It was the worse nite of our stay in Vegas, The carpet was filthy the valet was terible he suggested i was on something. LOL the front desk was so slow my grandma is faster then they are. the key cards didn't work my wife had to wait a 1/2 an hour for me to get back to here. The only thing i like there was the waitres in the Marino room and the wings. Thanks for a bad evening Hooters Jim

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 21stbday
Reviews.Content: Room had major issues. The bath tub didnt drain so the water back up to our ankles and the bathroon sink had plumbing problems. I told the front desk about the room as soon as it started that night. The next morning, the remodeling started next door.. When I asked to change rooms, the supervisor (she) told me it would be a hour before we could change. After a hour went by, I asked the front desk,they kept saying not sure when a room would be available, The one had a hole punched in it. After several hours went by, I asked the front desk again,he said still not ready yet., I told him that the supervisor said it would only be an hour, yea right! He went back and spoke to the same supervisor WOW he came up with a room, finally after waiting all day. I know we get what we pay for, But OMG this was very bad. So was your public relations. Your website is very false leading. At least one thing room service was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters!.......it was ok”
Reviews.Author: AA7482
Reviews.Content: -As far as the rooms go, the rooms are actually quite nice. The beds are comfy, there is a nice atmosphere in the rooms as well. -The casino is average and isn't nearly as big and glamorous as others on the strip but works well if you just want to play a couple of video machines and they have a few reasonably priced table games. -The pool is just fair, if your looking for a nice pool there are a lot of other places to go for a great value ie. (The Tropicana right next door has a fabulous pool for the money) location-it is a little off the strip. so if you are looking for a lot of time on the strip it would be wise to get a hotel right on the strip. ( the flamingo, harrah's all for around the same price. Restaurants- Hooters restaurant is good of course. Dan Marino's is just fair. -Overall it is just a run of the mill hotel in vegas. Its not the best but isn't the worst especially for the price on/near the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Did I really pay for this??”
Reviews.Author: Taahoe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Vegas and have to share with you. This place is a dump. From the snotty front desk, to the bad food, filthy dirty carpet in the halls, nasty windows. For the $30 price tag was expecting dated maybe but not just nasty gross. We went to the Dan Marino for Sunday brunch - OMG! Seat yourself fine..all tables dirty, busser took our drink order after 10 minutes, another 10 then someone else brought them. We got our silverware from another table, along with condiments, waitress was polite but a horrible waitress. After the entire 1 hour, I asked to pay for one buffet as i took one plate and left most of it. They did comp the meal but I would never go back again. Room was ok size but nasty carpet, filthy windows, and a/c unit that ran all of the time, and not quietly. Outside was 107 so turning it off was not an option. It was basically a spring break, sleep, puke and party situation. One passed out in the hall by the phones while I was walking to the restroom, another left a bucket of vomit by the soda/ice machine on our floor..it stayed all night and into the next morning.. Save yourself and pay another 20 bucks and stay somewhere else. The only positive was the polite security guard that showed us to our room and came back again to open the doors when the keys did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad--”
Reviews.Author: millerb
Reviews.Content: Check in was good. Hotel ,pool and casino is small.Did not win at the casino,did see someone win 1000.00 on the free 100.00 games.Was upgraded to the tower rooms,no charge.The rooms were ok--mostly just slept there.The cleaning service was good-The air condition worked good in the room.Stayed 4 nights--190.00--not bad--You have to walk to the MGM to get to the strip--or else a long walk up the street--only a 12.00 taxi fare from the airport-Overall you have to get a good deal to stay here--It is like a hotel,good to slept- shower and go do your thing.Did not eat there not sure how the places are.Not a bad place--they do try---

Reviews.Title: “Dingy rooms but okay overall”
Reviews.Author: gweilo845
Reviews.Content: I probably wouldn't have stayed here, but I got a great deal on a room, so I gave it a shot. Pros: Small casino - easy to get to/from your room. Didn't do much gambling, but made out pretty good on what I did, and the cocktail waitresses were quick to bring comped drinks, even when I was just playing penny slots. Very friendly staff - upgraded my room for free, bartenders were cool and made good drinks. Nice eye candy from most of the Hooters girls. Decent location - technically off the strip, but you can be on Las Vegas Blvd. within minutes. If you cross Tropicana to the MGM's back entrance, it is a quick walk to get to the monorail. If you're planning to go downtown, you can head a block south and get the route 109, which is cheaper, less crowded, and much faster than the Deuce. Room service food was good overall - got to my room in about 15 minutes and the quality of the food actually wasn't that bad. Good deals on food if you're not too picky - the Dan Marino's tries to be classy but basically it's a glorified Hooters. The 25 cent wings after midnight did hit the spot after a long day of drinking though. Beds were clean and comfortable. It was actually pretty quiet in the hallways and I didn't hear any noise from my neighbors - overall I got some good sleep in the room. Cons: Elevators look and sound like they're about to collapse. They're almost as bad as the notorious ones at the Imperial Palace. Hallways and rooms are in serious need of rehab.
