We headed to the 24 hr.cafe/diner (forgot the name) and had a great eggs/bacon/pancake breakfast which ran about $8/person....cheap!! Next we headed to the pool. The pool was a bit crowded, but in a fun way. There were beautiful women everywhere, including the Hooters calendar girls which were walking around trying to sell autographed copies of their calendars. Still, there were a lot more men than women. The casino was a bit small, but big enough to be fun. I had fun playing craps, and this dealer girl with funky glasses kept giving me betting tips. Hooters is right behind the Tropicana, which means that the strip is within walking distance. We walked to the MGM Grand, the NYNY, and the Tropicana. One problem that I did have, which I've had at other hotels, is that in the late morning/early afternoon, everyone wants to use the elevators at the same time. So, it took me 30-40 minutes to get from my room to the casino because all of the elevators were full. One other problem that I had was that the parking spaces in the structure are terribly small. It seemed as if all of them were of compact-size. Also, there was trash on the ground all throughout the parking structure. Check-out was a breeze. We stopped at the bar (which is directly in front of the reservations desk) before leaving to have one last shot, and the hooters girl that helped us gave us the shots for free even though we weren't gambling. All in all, it was an excellent place to stay, especially for single men and/or bachelor parties. For less than $120/night, this place was a deal. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service I have Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hooters Casino just last week, and the service there was terrible. I have never been treated as bad as I was by the front desk people at any other hotel. I checked in and found that my room was a single bed instead of the double. It took almost three hours to rectify the situation, all the while screwing up the begining of my vacation. Once they had there so called fix, it put me in one of the towers, 14 floors away from the pool I wanted to stay next to in the first place. I come to find out later that there were other rooms available by the pool, but the front desk forgot to look at those rooms. After getting jacked around for three hours by a manager that was supposed to show up to fix the situation (she never showed up) I finally settled into my room. The next night I ordered a plate of Nachos from the Damn Restaurant down stairs, it took me almost an hour to get the plate and afterwards when I finally got it, they robbed me of the steak that was supposed to be on it, that cost me 3.95 and the cheese was not even melted, and it was cold. Finally when I checked out they tried to charge me for the room that was in the tower, not at the bungalow rates, a mistake that they themselves screwed up. The casino is not better that any other one I stayed at, Hooters hot wings are not the best in the world, and good looking girls in skimpy outfits are a dime a dozen in Las Vegas. Spend you money elsewhere. This place is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: firefighterinsac
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights June 25th nad 26th. I checked in at 8 AM and they said the room would be ready at 3. I came back at 11 AM and they gave us keys for the bungalows which is the 2 story part of the hotel next to the pool. When I arrived at the room it had a king bed instead of 2 doubles. I called the front desk to get it changed, and to make a long story short 1 1/2 hours later and a headache I had the correct room and a meal comp for the trouble. The front desk staff, dealers, waitresses. security, and anyone I left out was very nice and helpfull. The room was nice, nothing special except for the beds. Itwas the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The bathroom was standard, toilet, sink, and shower. There are no dressers to put clothes in but there is a long closet to hang things up. If you need a hair dryer you will need to bring your own or call the front desk for one or anything else you might need. The rooms are not sound proof but I did not here anyone making noise either. I will tell you that this is a party hotel because I only saw 4 kids during my stay. The crowd seems to be in there 20's and 30's. Like I said earlier, my room was the bungalow room. This is a 2 story section not connected to the rest of the hotel. It is next to the pool. If you get a ground floor room you can walk out your sliding door to the pool 15 feet away. You will need to use your key to get in through the security gate. All my pool pictures were taken from my sliding door. There is seperate parking next to the rooms so you will not have to walk through the casino for anything. There are 2 pools and 2 hot tubs, with one being a 60 person hot tub. 1 pool also has a waterfall which was nice. The only bad thing is that the pool area has no shade unless you are at the bar. The sun does not go behind the hotel until about 6 PM. I ate in hooters restauant of course and it is just like anywhere else. Same menu same food. I also ate at the dam which is the 24 hour cafe. Very good. I had a burger which was huge. There are several bars throughout the property with nippers pool bar being the most fun. It is located poolside with live music on the weekends for the pool party. The casino is small with your average table games. If you want something other than blackjack or craps go to a bigger hotel. The strip is about a 5 minute walk if you are slow. All in all I had a great time here and would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good room”
Reviews.Author: BeachgalAlabamaUSA
Reviews.Content: Women travelers - go here to see throngs of men and if you want to be their eye candy. We stayed in the bungalows next to the pool, but on the side by the parking lot. The front desk warned us it may be noisy, but it wasn't noisy at all for us. Had a king size, non-smoking room. The bed was awesome - large, comfy, great sheets, feather pillows. A downside was there were no drawers what-so-ever in the entire room. And the only mirror was in the bathroom. The interior was entirely redone, but the carpet looked old and the A/C unit wasn't the newest. But in general, nothing to complain about with the room. The location on the strip is extremely convenient. 5 min. walk to the Tropicana, MGM, Exclibar, Luxor, or Mandalay Bay. We might stay there again just due to the convenient location. Don't fall for the speel from the time share folks on-site - MAJOR waste of 4 hours. The casino is small; maybe 20 blackjack tables, and 2 craps tables. But they did occasionally have $5 tables. We stayed there but only played about $40 at the casino, as we gambled mainly at the Tropicana and MGM. Overall, not a bad place. Just be prepared for the funny looks you get when you tell people you are staying at Hooters. Oh, and at the Hooters restaraunt, the grilled chicken sandwich was HORRIBLE. Stick to the wings.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok Casino”
Reviews.Author: jgb0607
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hooters for one night on May 28/29.... The check-in was a nightmare as apparently my reservation through orbitz never came through to them. I have heard of this problem before, especially on buys weekends. We ended up personally calling Orbitz while we were waiting and had them re-fax the reservation over. They did make up this longer wait by giving us a suite which was fairly large with 2 bathrooms, a large sectional sofa and a nice flatscreen TV. We then proceeded to get cleaned up and noticed the showers were screwed up as the water temperature kept fluctuating like someone was flushing a toilet in the bathroom. The beds were actually comfy..... The other incident I had was in the 24 hour cafe as I ordered a pizza to go and waited over 40 minutes for it to learn that it was apparently given to someone else. This was at 2 AM, but this is Vegas and you should have some sort of respectable service. I was not the only there that was agitated as several patrons were complaining. I would probably never stay there again......

Reviews.Title: “Good for Those 40 somethings Still in College”
Reviews.Author: redsaidfred
Reviews.Content: This place is a little different. It is the old San Remo Hotel that sat behind the Tropicana. Now I have stayed in a lot of 'Vegas hotels and my favorites are Treasure Island and Hooters. Hooters is a deal. The room is only $79 but it may have gone up since I suspect that the casino is proving to be more popular than expected. Anyway, here are the high points: They have the best looking staff of any casino I have ever been in. The girls are great and friendly too. The casino is on the small side but they have everything you would want. A couple of good places to eat. They throw blow out pool parties on weekends and the pool area is pretty good even by Vegas standards. I have been told that Vegas hotels put no money into their pool areas because they want you at the slots, but the Hooters pool area is made up like a beach party with a cabana and those great women bring you the drinks. Super friendly staff. They also have a good martini bar with live music. The downside: spa sucks. Waste of time there. Here is the deal. If you like Hooters restraunts, you will L-O-V-E the casino. If you don't like orange, NASCAR, lots of men in their 40s partying like its 1999, stay away! I talked to one of the managers. He was a real nice guy. I told him I was going to return because I had so much fun. I tell ya, it is the most customer friendly hotel I have ever stayed in. -W ps The hotel promises "no Paris, no Jessica, but you might get lucky". They do not lie.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters is a good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 5 night at hooters was good experience over all. The staff was friendly and attractive (Hooters Girls, Pool Wait Staff). The food was good at the restaurants. The rooms were clean and well appointed. My gripe was some on my neighbors who were under 25 and come home loaded slamming doors every night at 4:30.

Reviews.Title: “Hooters Doesn't Give a Hoot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a jaunt to LV for a family reunion this past week, we decided to check out the "new" Hooters. We were in for a very rude awakening shortly after checking in. Our room had been broken into and things taken. Sadly for the hotel, there were no security checks at the elevators as there are in all the other hotels. We filed a report with security and promptly checked out of there and went to Excalibur where we were given exceptional service. Once there, I discovered I had left my neck pillow at Hooters. A call was made to them, and they had no record of us registering, no pillow had been turned in, so I spent the entire week without my neck pillow. Thankfully, our family reunion was not totally ruined thanks to the expert care at Excalibur. As for Hooters, well they don't seem to give a "Hoot" about their guests. We will never go there again! Travelers beware!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, new furniture and comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hooters twice now. For the ladies that don't want their guys to stay there, don't worry. There are sooo many guys there they out number the girls probably 20 to 1!! Go ahead and stay because you will appreciate the clean rooms and new furniture! The beds are tall and very comfortable, which is great after all of the walking you do in Vegas! They even triple sheet the beds, which is usually only done in the more expensive hotels. Oh, and the sheets actually fit the bed, I don't know if you travel much, but usually the sheets don't fit the bed and become untucked. The Dam Restaurant has excellent pizza, it was loaded with stuff. For Hooters Restaurant, both on Friday and Saturday nights expect to wait 1 1/2 hours to get a table. They really don't have a lot of slots and they don't seem to get played much, but their table games are busy. They have just the right amount of play area for the hotel size. One good thing is if you are staying in the hotel you don't have to walk miles and track all over the place with your suitcase just to get to your room. It is the only place we found in Vegas or Henderson that you dont have to follow sign after sign and walk thru the crowded casino with people tripping over your suitcase while you hike your way to your room. That is the reason we stayed the 2nd time. Quick and easy access to your room, pool, restaurants and parking lot. You are just off the strip across from the MGM Grand and are on the good end of the strip and not far from the airport, so Location, Location, Location!! If you do make reservations I would call the hotel directly because the rooms are cheaper. Their front desk staff has to be the worst I have seen. I was quoted on the phone $59 for the Ocean View tower or $49 for the Bay View Tower. I wanted the Ocean View and when we got there they put us in the Bay View, so naturally I asked for the lower price and it was like pulling teeth to get them to change the price, but finally she did and then told me that both towers were the same price --$49--, that by going thru the hotel it is always $10 cheaper. I don't think they have a true policy of rates, because I did call to make the reservations. We will stay again, due to the location, new furniture and comfortable beds!

Reviews.Title: “Good Fun!”
Reviews.Author: TheBrit
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days at Hooters and it was certainly fun. The hotel is being refurbished and some parts are looking good but the bedroom we stayed in was in need of an update. The room was a reasonable size and the casino was not as impersonal as the bigger hotels. There is a nice pool area which they have just finished updating with a large waterfall and lighting. Hooters restaurant is great and the staff (not just the short-shorted, t-shirted Hooters girls!) we all efficient and friendly. We paid around $100 a night and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was really nice!! The decor in the room was awesome and they were really spacious. The service from the Hooters Girls was amazing. Ezpecially considering we had a group of 5 girls! They were super nice!! However, The service at the front desk was not always the greatest and we were told different things when we checked in than when we booked the reservation as far as the rate went and they were not very willing to work with us. Oh well though. It was worth it! All of the restaurants had great food, but the service again at one of them was just okay. I think they screwed up every time we ate there. But they were always really quick to fix it and take care of it!! Otherwise everything was great!!! I definitely recommend it!!! And I would for sure stay there again! Plus ladies.... the place is crawling with guys!!!!! oh one more thing... be really careful of the balconies.. they are really tiny and the sliding glass doors get stuck a lot!! Take our word for it.. You don't want to get stuck on one of them!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a gambler there rating system is done by hand. It was wrong all the time and did not rate me as it should have. Very disapointed they should stay with the food chain not the casino end. Everyone knew about the mistakes from the valet guys to the bell men who have more experience than the people running the casino.

Reviews.Title: “tacky, without the delight.”
Reviews.Author: AlexD512
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one evening for a guys night out. As such, I wasn't expecting anything more than a change clothes and crash for the night. Overall, they've just put a fresh coat of paint and nailed on some unfinished wood wherever they can fit it, which resulted in a hotel that kind of had a lumberyard smell to it. The rooms were functional, but not at all glamorous. The Hooters branding in the rooms seems to have been to throw in a couple barstools and add some orange lampshades. Our toilet never seemed to flush right, and the showerhead appeared to have been the original one from the San Remo days: all clogged up and spouting at angles. As others have mentioned, room noise was apparent to us, and even in a state of exhaustion and drunkeness at 4am, we were kept up by a couple arguing, crying, and tossing things around upstairs. The gaming downstairs is ok, but after the novelty of hooters girls wears off, isn't anything special. Plus, it's a mostly-male sawdust joint vibe downstairs, which shouldn't be much of a suprise if you're familiar with Hooters. Food options were limited at 3am, and it seemed the staff in the cafes were always shorthanded or disorganized because long waits were the norm. The signature chicken wings also didn't seem to be what they usually are in the restauraunt, which was disappointing. Wouldn't recommend for couples or anyone looking for a remotely personal or classy vegas hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: mlm373
Reviews.Content: Got in around 11pm on Friday 3/3, walked right up to the counter and checked in - no wait at all. We had 3 people offer to check us in. Within 2 minutes we had our room key for room 1135 with views of Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur and NYNY - not too shabby. Room wasn't as orange and bright as the online pictures made it out to be. The bed was unusually high for a hotel and it was soft and comfy. Cute 'beachy' theme throughout. Plenty of room to get ready - 3 full length mirrors and a separate vanity outside of the bathroom. Everything was clean. Shower was high (good for tall husband) and had just the right amount of power. Negatives in the room were ancient alarm clock, bathroom sink wouldn't hold water and the air conditioner was unusually noisy. Casino is crowded and extremely loud. Hooter girls seemed to be more covered up than they are in our local restaurant here in NE which I thought was odd. Band in the bar was decent and fun. Good location right across the street from the monorail. I would definately stay here again and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a reasonable hotel and doesn't mind walking a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: texan_8
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas for a business trip and we decided to go see the new Hotel. Supposedly they spent 55 mil. renovating the old San Remo but am not sure where that all went. The casino seemed to be very small and you would think that all dealers would be girls, but I would say 40% of the dealers were guys including mine! We waited approx. 1 hour to get into the restaurant which I thought was a little long to eat wings. The dealers were extremely slow and did seem to make lots of mistakes. We did not get a chance to look in the rooms, but the casino and restaurant were a big disappointment and would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for business”
Reviews.Author: tex2step
Reviews.Content: This place has potential, but it's got a long way to go. First off, for you casino players- the player card readers in the slot machines rarely work. The club orange workers are slow and not attentive. It took us about 25 minutes to get a one hundred dollar pay out on a slot machine. We had casino workers tell us they would be right with us but never did. If I had won the money, that would have been fine. But, this is what I had put into the machine. Although there were drink waitresses, I rarely saw them. As for the hotel--- the set up is pretty freaky. One bank of elevators broke down three times in the short time I was there. It is very difficult to get in to the check in area from the parking garage. You have to go through a ton of people in a tighter than usual set up. Literally, from the check in counter, you are less than two feet away from about 10 slot machines. We had a very nice two bedroom suite; but one of the sinks did not work. The refrigerator was in the middle of the room still wrapped in plastic. Some of the electrical ports did not work. This was the same with some of the light switches. The noise from the parking garge carries to all the rooms on the side of the garage. So there were car alarms going off all night and drunken guys screaming at 4am that they could not find their keys (a bad situation no matter how you look at it). We met a few other guests who had bad experiences. I will chalk this one up to the hotel being new and NOT yet having it's groove. But with the way the staff was, it seemed like they had been there for years and many of them seemed disgruntled. Don't bother with room service during peak hours-- the food will be cold by the time you get it. Still, I would consider giving this place another shot- but I will wait at least a year before I do. If you do stay here and you are near the parking garage- make them switch you. There's nothing worst than waking up to car alarms all night long with a hangover coming on.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a professional meeting in Vegas and frankly could not get a reasonably priced room elsewhere. The reviews I read where bad. What a pleasant surprise. Great view from my room of the nearby strip, natural pine decoration made it feel homey, and the room did seem "tropically casual". Very comfortable, clean and extremely friendly staff. The room service was slow but the food good, prices fair. A great retreat from the crazy husle and busle of the big and loud casino hotels. Short walk from entrance to room. I would return here. Incidently, the Hooter Girls seemed innocent compared to the garb other casinos put on their woman employees. This place is nice for business people, couples and singles. Also, the sushi bar in the Bait Shop was a hidden delight.

HotelInfo.Name: Hooters Casino Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 115 East Tropicana Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89109
